1797  if(jj >= nDOFsLocOwned) {
1798  SU2_MPI::Error("This DOF should be owned, but it is not. This should not happen.",CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1799  }
1800  sendReturnBuf[i][j] = colorLocalDOFs[jj];
1801  }
1802 
1803  /* Send the return buffer back to the calling rank. Again use non-blocking
1804  sends to avoid deadlock. */
1805  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendReturnBuf[i].data(), sendReturnBuf[i].size(), MPI_INT,
1806  source, source+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReturnReqs[i]);
1807  }
1808 
1809  /* Complete the first round of non-blocking sends. */
1810  SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1811 
1812  /* Loop over the ranks from which I receive the return information. */
1813  for(unsigned long i=0; i<rankCommToInd.size(); ++i) {
1814 
1815  /* Block until a message arrives and determine the source of the message
1816  and its index in the original send buffers. */
1817  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1818  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1819  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1820 
1821  MI = rankCommToInd.find(source);
1822  const int ind = MI->second;
1823 
1824  /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the message using
1825  a blocking receive. */
1826  vector<int> recvBuf(sendBuf[ind].size());
1827  SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), recvBuf.size(), MPI_INT,
1828  source, rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1829 
1830  /* Loop over the data just received and add them to the map
1831  mapMatrixIndToColor .*/
1832  for(unsigned long j=0; j<sendBuf[ind].size(); ++j)
1833  mapMatrixIndToColor[sendBuf[ind][j]] = recvBuf[j];
1834  }
1835 
1836  /* Complete the second round of non-blocking sends. */
1837  SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReturnReqs.size(), sendReturnReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1838 
1839  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1840  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1841  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1842 
1843 #endif
1844 
1845  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1846  /*--- Part 3: For each locally owned DOF it is determined which matrix ---*/
1847  /*--- entry is computed for which color. This information is ---*/
1848  /*--- stored in the vector of vectors colorToIndEntriesJacobian. ---*/
1849  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1850 
1851  /* Loop over the ownded DOFs. */
1852  colorToIndEntriesJacobian.resize(nDOFsLocOwned);
1853  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
1854 
1855  /* Initialize the elements of colorToIndEntriesJacobian to -1 to indicate
1856  that the color does not have a matrix entity . */
1857  colorToIndEntriesJacobian[i].assign(nGlobalColors, -1);
1858 
1859  /* Loop over the matrix entries of this DOF. */
1860  for(int j=0; j<(int) nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i].size(); ++j) {
1861 
1862  /* Search for the entry in mapMatrixIndToColor and determine the
1863  color of this entry. */
1864  map<unsigned long, int>::const_iterator MMI;
1865  MMI = mapMatrixIndToColor.find(nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i][j]);
1866  if(MMI == mapMatrixIndToColor.end()) {
1867  cout << "Matrix entry not found in mapMatrixIndToColor." << endl;
1868  cout << "This should not happen." << endl;
1869  exit(1);
1870  }
1871  const int color = MMI->second;
1872 
1873  /* Set the correct information in colorToIndEntriesJacobian. */
1874  colorToIndEntriesJacobian[i][color] = j;
1875  }
1876  }
1877 }
1878 
1879 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetUpTaskList(CConfig *config) {
1880 
1881  /* Check whether an ADER space-time step must be carried out.
1882  When only a spatial Jacobian is computed this is false per definition. */
1883  if( (config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) &&
1884  !(config->GetJacobian_Spatial_Discretization_Only()) ) {
1885 
1886  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1887  /* ADER time integration with local time stepping. There are 2^(M-1) */
1888  /* subtime steps, where M is the number of time levels. For each of */
1889  /* the subtime steps a number of tasks must be carried out, hence the */
1890  /* total list can become rather lengthy. */
1891  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1892 
1893  /*--- Determine whether or not the predictor solution must be interpolated
1894  for the time levels on this rank. Make a distinction between owned
1895  and halo elements. Also determine whether or not boundary conditions
1896  are present and whether or not these depend on halo data. ---*/
1897  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
1898  vector<bool> interpolOwnedElem(nTimeLevels, false);
1899  vector<bool> interpolHaloElem(nTimeLevels, false);
1900  vector<bool> BCPresent(nTimeLevels, false);
1901  vector<bool> BCDependOnHalos(nTimeLevels, false);
1902 
1903  for(unsigned short level=0; level<nTimeLevels; ++level) {
1904 
1905  /* First check the boundary conditions. */
1906  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
1907 
1908  const unsigned long surfElemBeg = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[level];
1909  const unsigned long surfElemEnd = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[level+1];
1910  if(surfElemEnd > surfElemBeg) {
1911  BCPresent[level] = true;
1912  if( boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC ) BCDependOnHalos[level] = true;
1913  }
1914  }
1915 
1916  /* Determine whether or not the owned elements must be interpolated. */
1917  if(nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1] > nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level])
1918  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1919  if(nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level])
1920  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1921  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level])
1922  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1923  if( BCPresent[level] )
1924  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1925 
1926  /* Determine whether or not the halo elements must be interpolated. */
1927  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level])
1928  interpolHaloElem[level] = true;
1929  if( BCDependOnHalos[level] )
1930  interpolHaloElem[level] = true;
1931  }
1932 
1933  /* Determine the number of subtime steps and abbreviate the number of
1934  time integration points a bit easier. */
1935  const unsigned int nSubTimeSteps = pow(2,nTimeLevels-1);
1936  const unsigned short nTimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
1937 
1938  /* Define the two dimensional vector to store the latest index for a
1939  certain task for every time level. */
1940  vector<vector<int> > indexInList(CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION+1,
1941  vector<int>(nTimeLevels, -1));
1942 
1943  /* Loop over the number of subtime steps in the algorithm. */
1944  for(unsigned int step=0; step<nSubTimeSteps; ++step) {
1945 
1946  /* Determine the time level for which an update must be carried out
1947  for this step. */
1948  unsigned int ii = step+1;
1949  unsigned short timeLevel = 0;
1950  while( !(ii%2) ) {ii/=2; ++timeLevel;}
1951 
1952  /* Definition of the variable to store previous indices of
1953  tasks that must have been completed. */
1954  int prevInd[5];
1955 
1956  /* Carry out the predictor step of the communication elements of level 0
1957  if these elements are present on this rank. */
1958  unsigned long elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0]
1959  + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[0];
1960  unsigned long elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[1];
1961  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
1962  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][0];
1963  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
1964  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS, 0, prevInd[0]));
1965  }
1966 
1967  /* Initiate the communication of elements of level 0, if there is
1968  something to be communicated. */
1969 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1970  if( commRequests[0].size() ) {
1971  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) // Data needs to be computed before sending.
1972  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0];
1973  else // Data only needs to be received.
1974  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][0];
1975 
1976  /* Make sure that any previous communication has been completed. */
1977  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0];
1978 
1979  /* Create the task. */
1980  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0] = tasksList.size();
1981  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0,
1982  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
1983  }
1984 #endif
1985 
1986  /* Check if the time level is not nTimeLevels-1. In that case carry out
1987  the predictor step of the communication elements for the next time
1988  level and initiate their communication, if appropriate on this rank. */
1989  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
1990  const unsigned short nL = timeLevel+1;
1991 
1992  /* Carry out the predictor step of the communication elements of level nL
1993  if these elements are present on this rank. */
1994  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[nL];
1995  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL+1];
1996 
1997  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
1998  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][nL];
1999  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2000  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS, nL, prevInd[0]));
2001  }
2002 
2003  /* Initiate the communication of elements of level nL, if there is
2004  something to be communicated. */
2005 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2006  if( commRequests[nL].size() ) {
2007  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) // Data needs to be computed before sending.
2008  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL];
2009  else // Data only needs to be received.
2010  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][nL];
2011 
2012  /* Make sure that any previous communication has been completed. */
2013  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL];
2014 
2015  /* Create the actual task. */
2016  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL] = tasksList.size();
2017  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, nL,
2018  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2019  }
2020 #endif
2021  }
2022 
2023  /* Carry out the predictor step of the internal elements of time level 0,
2024  if these elements are present on this rank. */
2025  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0];
2026  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[0];
2027 
2028  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
2029  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][0];
2030  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
2031  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS, 0, prevInd[0]));
2032  }
2033 
2034  /* Determine the tasks to be completed before the communication of time
2035  level 0 can be completed. */
2036  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = prevInd[2] = -1;
2037 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2038  if( commRequests[0].size() )
2039  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0];
2040 #endif
2041 
2042  if( elementsSendSelfComm[0].size() ) {
2043  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0];
2044  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][0];
2045  }
2046 
2047  /* Make sure that the -1 in prevInd, if any, are numbered last. */
2048  sort(prevInd, prevInd+3, greater<int>());
2049 
2050  /* Complete the communication of time level 0, if there is something
2051  to be completed. */
2052  if(prevInd[0] > -1) {
2053  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
2054  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0,
2055  prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2056  }
2057 
2058  /* Check if the time level is not nTimeLevels-1. In that case carry out
2059  the predictor step of the internal elements for the next time
2060  level and complete the communication for this time level,
2061  if appropriate on this rank. */
2062  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
2063  const unsigned short nL = timeLevel+1;
2064 
2065  /* Carry out the predictor step of the internal elements of level nL
2066  if these elements are present on this rank. */
2067  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL];
2068  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[nL];
2069 
2070  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
2071  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][nL];
2072  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2073  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS, nL, prevInd[0]));
2074  }
2075 
2076  /* Determine the tasks to be completed before the communication of time
2077  level nL can be completed. */
2078  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = prevInd[2] = -1;
2079 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2080  if( commRequests[nL].size() )
2081  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL];
2082 #endif
2083 
2084  if( elementsSendSelfComm[nL].size() ) {
2085  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL];
2086  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][nL];
2087  }
2088 
2089  /* Make sure that the -1 in prevInd, if any, are numbered last. */
2090  sort(prevInd, prevInd+3, greater<int>());
2091 
2092  /* Complete the communication of time level nL, if there is something
2093  to be completed. */
2094  if(prevInd[0] > -1) {
2095  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2096  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, nL,
2097  prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2098  }
2099  }
2100 
2101  /* Loop over the time integration points to compute the space time
2102  integral for the corrector step. */
2103  for(unsigned short intPoint=0; intPoint<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++intPoint) {
2104 
2105  /* Loop over the time levels to be treated. */
2106  for(unsigned short level=0; level<=timeLevel; ++level) {
2107 
2108  /* Easier storage of the number of owned elements for this level
2109  and the number of owned elements of the adjacent time level
2110  that are needed for the computation of the surface integral. */
2111  unsigned long nOwnedElem = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1]
2112  - nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level];
2113 
2114  unsigned long nAdjOwnedElem = 0;
2115  if(level < (nTimeLevels-1))
2116  nAdjOwnedElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level+1].size();
2117 
2118  /* Check if the solution of the owned elements of the current time
2119  level and the adjacent owned elements of the next time level must
2120  be interpolated to the integration point intPoint. */
2121  if( interpolOwnedElem[level] ) {
2122 
2123  /* Determine the tasks that should have been completed before this
2124  task can be carried out. This depends on the time integration
2125  point. */
2126  if(intPoint == 0) {
2127 
2128  /* First time integration point. The predictor steps of the
2129  owned elements must have been completed before this task
2130  can be carried out. */
2131  if( nOwnedElem ) {
2132  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][level];
2133  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][level];
2134  }
2135  else {
2136  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = -1;
2137  }
2138 
2139  if( nAdjOwnedElem ) {
2140  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][level+1];
2141  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][level+1];
2142  }
2143  else {
2144  prevInd[2] = prevInd[3] = -1;
2145  }
2146 
2147  prevInd[4] = -1;
2148  }
2149  else {
2150 
2151  /* Not the first integration point. The residual computations of
2152  the previous integration point must have been completed, because
2153  the solution in the work vectors is overwritten. */
2154  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level];
2155  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level];
2156  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2157  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2158  prevInd[4] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2159  }
2160 
2161  /* Create the task. */
2162  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2163  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2164  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2], prevInd[3], prevInd[4]));
2165 
2166  /* The info on the integration point and whether or not this
2167  time integration corresponds to the second part for the
2168  adjacent elements must be added to the task just created. */
2169  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2170  tasksList.back().secondPartTimeIntADER = level < timeLevel;
2171 
2172  /* If artificial viscosity is used for the shock capturing
2173  terms, these terms must be computed for the owned elements,
2174  including the adjacent ones. */
2175  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2176  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2177  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2178  level, prevInd[0]));
2179  }
2180 
2181  /* The solution of the halo elements of the current time level and
2182  the adjacent halo elements of the next time level must be
2183  interpolated to the integration point intPoint. Check if these
2184  elements are present. */
2185  if( interpolHaloElem[level] ) {
2186 
2187  unsigned long nAdjHaloElem = 0;
2188  if(level < (nTimeLevels-1))
2189  nAdjHaloElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level+1].size();
2190 
2191  unsigned long nHaloElem = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[level+1]
2192  - nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[level];
2193 
2194  /* Determine the tasks that should have been completed before this
2195  task can be carried out. This depends on the time integration
2196  point. */
2197  if(intPoint == 0) {
2198 
2199  /* First time integration point. The communication of the
2200  halo elements must have been completed before this task
2201  can be carried out. */
2202  if( nHaloElem )
2203  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2204  else
2205  prevInd[0] = -1;
2206 
2207  if( nAdjHaloElem )
2208  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level+1];
2209  else
2210  prevInd[1] = -1;
2211  }
2212  else {
2213 
2214  /* Not the first integration point. The residual computation of
2215  the previous integration point must have been completed, because
2216  the solution in the work vectors is overwritten. */
2217  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2218  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2219  }
2220 
2221  /* Create the task. */
2222  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2223  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2224  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2225 
2226  /* The info on the integration point and whether or not this
2227  time integration corresponds to the second part for the
2228  adjacent elements must be added to the task just created. */
2229  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2230  tasksList.back().secondPartTimeIntADER = level < timeLevel;
2231 
2232  /* If artificial viscosity is used for the shock capturing
2233  terms, these terms must be computed for the halo elements,
2234  including the adjacent ones. */
2235  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2236  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2237  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2238  level, prevInd[0]));
2239  }
2240 
2241  /* Check whether there are boundary conditions that involve halo elements. */
2242  if( BCDependOnHalos[level] ) {
2243 
2244  /* Create the dependency list for this task. */
2245  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2246  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2247 
2248  /* Create the task for the boundary conditions that involve halo elements. */
2249  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2250  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO,
2251  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2252  }
2253 
2254  /* Compute the surface residuals for this time level that involve
2255  halo elements, if present. Afterwards, accumulate the space time
2256  residuals for the halo elements. */
2257  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] >
2258  nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level]) {
2259 
2260  /* Create the dependencies for the surface residual part that involve
2261  halo elements. For all but the first integration point, make sure
2262  that the previous residual is already accumulated, because this
2263  task will overwrite that residual. */
2264  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2265  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2266 
2267  if(intPoint == 0)
2268  prevInd[2] = -1;
2269  else
2270  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2271 
2272  /* Create the task for the surface residual. */
2273  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2274  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2275  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2276 
2277  /* Create the task to accumulate the surface residuals of the halo
2278  elements. Make sure to set the integration point for this task. */
2279  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2280  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2281  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2282  level, prevInd[0]));
2283  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2284  }
2285 
2286  /* If this is the last integration point, initiate the reverse
2287  communication for the residuals of this time level, if there
2288  is something to communicate. */
2289  if(intPoint == (nTimeIntegrationPoints-1)) {
2290 
2291  /* Check if there is something to communicate. Despite the fact
2292  that self communication takes place when the reverse communication
2293  is completed, a check for self communication is still needed,
2294  because of the periodic transformations. */
2295  bool commData = false;
2296 
2297 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2298  if( commRequests[level].size() ) commData = true;
2299 #endif
2300  if(commData || elementsSendSelfComm[level].size()) {
2301 
2302  /* Determine the dependencies before the reverse communication
2303  can start. */
2304  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2305  if( haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].size() )
2306  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2307  else
2308  prevInd[1] = -1;
2309 
2310  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2311 
2312  /* Create the task. */
2313  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2314  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION,
2315  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2316  }
2317  }
2318 
2319  /* Compute the contribution of the volume integral, boundary conditions that only
2320  involve owned elements and surface integral between owned elements for this
2321  time level, if present. */
2322  if( nOwnedElem ) {
2323 
2324  /* Create the dependencies for this task. The shock capturing viscosity of
2325  the owned elements must be completed and for all integration points but
2326  the first, the computed residuals must have been accumulated in the space
2327  time residual, because the tasks below will overwrite the residuals. */
2328  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2329  if(intPoint == 0)
2330  prevInd[1] = -1;
2331  else
2332  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2333 
2334  /* Create the tasks. */
2335  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2336  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL, level,
2337  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2338 
2339  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2340  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED, level,
2341  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2342 
2343  if(nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level+1] >
2344  nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level]) {
2345  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2346  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2347  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]));
2348  }
2349  }
2350 
2351  /* Accumulate the space time residuals for the owned elements of this
2352  level, if these elements are present. */
2353  if(nAdjOwnedElem || nOwnedElem) {
2354 
2355  /* Create the dependencies for this task. */
2356  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level];
2357  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level];
2358  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2359  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2360  prevInd[4] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2361 
2362  /* Create the task. */
2363  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2364  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2365  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2], prevInd[3], prevInd[4]));
2366  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2367  }
2368 
2369  /* If this is the last integration point, complete the reverse
2370  communication for the residuals of this time level, if there
2371  is something to communicate. */
2372  if(intPoint == (nTimeIntegrationPoints-1)) {
2373 
2374  bool commData = false;
2375 
2376 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2377  if( commRequests[level].size() ) commData = true;
2378 #endif
2379  if(commData || elementsSendSelfComm[level].size()) {
2380 
2381  /* Determine the dependencies before the reverse communication
2382  can be completed. */
2383  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2384  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2385  if( ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].size() )
2386  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2387  else
2388  prevInd[2] = -1;
2389 
2390  /* Create the task. */
2391  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2392  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION,
2393  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2394  }
2395  }
2396 
2397  } /* End loop time level. */
2398 
2399  } /* End loop time integration points. */
2400 
2401  /* Loop again over the number of active time levels for this subtime
2402  step and compute the update for the DOFs of the owned elements. */
2403  for(unsigned short level=0; level<=timeLevel; ++level) {
2404  if(nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1] > nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level]) {
2405 
2406  /* Updates must be carried out for this time level. First multiply the
2407  residuals by the inverse of the mass matrix. This task can be
2408  completed if the communication of this level has been completed.
2409  However, it is possible that no communication is needed and
2410  therefore the accumulation of the space time residuals is also
2411  added to the dependency list. */
2412  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2413  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2414  if( ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].size() )
2415  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2416  else
2417  prevInd[2] = -1;
2418 
2419  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2420  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX,
2421  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]));
2422 
2423  /* Compute the new state vector for this time level. */
2424  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX][level];
2425  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2426  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION,
2427  level, prevInd[0]));
2428  }
2429  }
2430 
2431  } /* End loop subtime steps. */
2432 
2433 
2434  // EXTRA FOR DEBUGGING
2435 /* for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
2436  if(i == rank) {
2437  cout << endl;
2438  cout << "Task list for rank " << rank << endl;
2439  cout << "------------------------------------------------" << endl;
2440  cout << "Number of tasks: " << tasksList.size() << endl;
2441  for(unsigned long j=0; j<tasksList.size(); ++j) {
2442 
2443  cout << "Task " << j << ": ";
2444  switch( tasksList[j].task ) {
2445  case CTaskDefinition::NO_TASK: cout << "NO_TASK" << endl; break;
2446  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2447  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2448  case CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2449  case CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2450  case CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2451  case CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2452  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2453  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2454  case CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2455  case CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2456  case CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL: cout << "VOLUME_RESIDUAL" << endl; break;
2457  case CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2458  case CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2459  case CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED: cout << "BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED" << endl; break;
2460  case CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO: cout << "BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO" << endl; break;
2461  case CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2462  case CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2463  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2464  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2465  case CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX: cout << "MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX" << endl; break;
2466  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION: cout << "ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION" << endl; break;
2467  default: cout << "This cannot happen" << endl;
2468  }
2469  cout << " Time level: " << tasksList[j].timeLevel
2470  << " Integration point: " << tasksList[j].intPointADER
2471  << " Second part: " << tasksList[j].secondPartTimeIntADER << endl;
2472  cout << " Depends on tasks:";
2473  for(unsigned short k=0; k<tasksList[j].nIndMustBeCompleted; ++k)
2474  cout << " " << tasksList[j].indMustBeCompleted[k];
2475  cout << endl << endl;
2476  }
2477 
2478  }
2479 
2480 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2481  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2482 #endif
2483  }
2484 
2485  cout << "CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetUpTaskList: ADER tasklist printed" << endl;
2486  exit(1); */
2487 
2488  // END EXTRA FOR DEBUGGING.
2489  }
2490  else {
2491 
2492  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2493  /* Standard time integration scheme for which the spatial residual must */
2494  /* be computed for the DOFS of the owned elements. This results in a */
2495  /* relatively short tasks list, which can be set easily. */
2496  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2497 
2498  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0)); // Task 0
2499  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0)); // Task 1
2500  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL, 0, 1)); // Task 2
2501  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 0)); // Task 3
2502  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 3)); // Task 4
2503  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 1, 4)); // Task 5
2504  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO, 0, 1, 3)); // Task 6
2505  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 5)); // Task 7
2506  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 7)); // Task 8
2507  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0, 1)); // Task 9
2508  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED, 0, 1)); // Task 10
2509  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 2, 8)); // Task 11
2510  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11)); // Task 12
2511  tasksList.push_back(CTaskDefinition(CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX, 0, 12)); // Task 13
2512  }
2513 }
2514 
2515 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Prepare_MPI_Communication(const CMeshFEM *FEMGeometry,
2516  CConfig *config) {
2517 
2518  /*--- Get the communication information from DG_Geometry. Note that for a
2519  FEM DG discretization the communication entities of FEMGeometry contain
2520  the volume elements. ---*/
2521  const vector<int> &ranksSend = FEMGeometry->GetRanksSend();
2522  const vector<int> &ranksRecv = FEMGeometry->GetRanksRecv();
2523  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &elementsSend = FEMGeometry->GetEntitiesSend();
2524  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &elementsRecv = FEMGeometry->GetEntitiesRecv();
2525 
2526  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2527  /*--- Step 1. Create the triple vector, which contains elements to be ---*/
2528  /*--- sent and received per time level. Note that when time ---*/
2529  /*--- accurate local time stepping is not used, this is just a ---*/
2530  /*--- copy of elementsSend and elementsRecv. ---*/
2531  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2532 
2533  /* Allocate the first two indices of the triple vectors. */
2534  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
2535 
2536  vector<vector<vector<unsigned long> > > elemSendPerTimeLevel, elemRecvPerTimeLevel;
2537  elemSendPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2538  elemRecvPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2539 
2540  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i) {
2541  elemSendPerTimeLevel[i].resize(elementsSend.size());
2542  elemRecvPerTimeLevel[i].resize(elementsRecv.size());
2543  }
2544 
2545  /* Loop over the send data and set the corresponding data
2546  in elemSendPerTimeLevel. */
2547  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSend.size(); ++i) {
2548  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSend[i].size(); ++j) {
2549  const unsigned long ii = elementsSend[i][j];
2550  elemSendPerTimeLevel[volElem[ii].timeLevel][i].push_back(ii);
2551  }
2552  }
2553 
2554  /* Loop over the receive data and set the corresponding data
2555  in recvSendPerTimeLevel. */
2556  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsRecv.size(); ++i) {
2557  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecv[i].size(); ++j) {
2558  const unsigned long ii = elementsRecv[i][j];
2559  elemRecvPerTimeLevel[volElem[ii].timeLevel][i].push_back(ii);
2560  }
2561  }
2562 
2563  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2564  /*--- Step 2. Find out whether or not self communication is present and ---*/
2565  /*--- set the corresponding data for elementsSendSelfComm and ---*/
2566  /*--- elementsRecvSelfComm for all time levels. This can only be ---*/
2567  /*--- the case when periodic boundaries are present in the grid. ---*/
2568  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2569 
2570  /* Allocate the first index of elementsSendSelfComm and elementsRecvSelfComm. */
2571  elementsSendSelfComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2572  elementsRecvSelfComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2573 
2574  /* Loop over the ranks to which data is sent and copy the elements for self
2575  communication for all time levels. */
2576  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2577  if(ranksSend[i] == rank) {
2578  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeLevels; ++j)
2579  elementsSendSelfComm[j] = elemSendPerTimeLevel[j][i];
2580  }
2581  }
2582 
2583  /* Loop over the ranks from which data is received and copy the elements
2584  for self communication for all time levels. */
2585  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2586  if(ranksRecv[i] == rank) {
2587  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeLevels; ++j)
2588  elementsRecvSelfComm[j] = elemRecvPerTimeLevel[j][i];
2589  }
2590  }
2591 
2592 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2593 
2594  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2595  /*--- Step 3. Determine the MPI communication patterns for ---*/
2596  /*--- all time levels. ---*/
2597  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2598 
2599  /* Determine the number of time DOFs that must be communicated.
2600  For non-ADER schemes this is simply set to 1. */
2601  unsigned short nTimeDOFs = 1;
2602  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG)
2603  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2604 
2605  /* Determine the number of items per DOF that must be communicated. */
2606  const unsigned short nItemsPerDOF = nTimeDOFs*nVar;
2607 
2608  /* Allocate the memory for the first index of the vectors that
2609  determine the MPI communication patterns. */
2610  commRequests.resize(nTimeLevels);
2611  elementsRecvMPIComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2612  elementsSendMPIComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2613  ranksRecvMPI.resize(nTimeLevels);
2614  ranksSendMPI.resize(nTimeLevels);
2615  commRecvBuf.resize(nTimeLevels);
2616  commSendBuf.resize(nTimeLevels);
2617 
2618  /* Loop over the time levels. */
2619  for(unsigned short level=0; level<nTimeLevels; ++level) {
2620 
2621  /* Determine the number of ranks from which data will be received
2622  for this time level. Self communication is excluded. */
2623  int nRankRecv = 0;
2624  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2625  if((ranksRecv[i] != rank) && elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i].size()) ++nRankRecv;
2626  }
2627 
2628  /* Determine the number of ranks to which data will be send
2629  for this time level. Self communication is excluded. */
2630  int nRankSend = 0;
2631  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2632  if((ranksSend[i] != rank) && elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i].size()) ++nRankSend;
2633  }
2634 
2635  /* Allocate the memory for the second index of the vectors that
2636  determine the MPI communication. */
2637  commRequests[level].resize(nRankRecv+nRankSend);
2638  elementsRecvMPIComm[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2639  elementsSendMPIComm[level].resize(nRankSend);
2640  ranksRecvMPI[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2641  ranksSendMPI[level].resize(nRankSend);
2642  commRecvBuf[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2643  commSendBuf[level].resize(nRankSend);
2644 
2645  /* Determine the receive information. */
2646  nRankRecv = 0;
2647  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2648  if((ranksRecv[i] != rank) && elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i].size()) {
2649 
2650  /* Copy the elements to be received and the rank from where they come. */
2651  elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv] = elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i];
2652  ranksRecvMPI[level][nRankRecv] = ranksRecv[i];
2653 
2654  /* Determine the size of the receive buffer and allocate the memory. */
2655  unsigned long sizeBuf = 0;
2656  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv].size(); ++j) {
2657  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv][j];
2658  sizeBuf += volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
2659  }
2660 
2661  sizeBuf *= nItemsPerDOF;
2662  commRecvBuf[level][nRankRecv].resize(sizeBuf);
2663 
2664  /* Update nRankRecv. */
2665  ++nRankRecv;
2666  }
2667  }
2668 
2669  /* Determine the send information. */
2670  nRankSend = 0;
2671  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2672  if((ranksSend[i] != rank) && elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i].size()) {
2673 
2674  /* Copy the elements to be sent and the rank to where they are sent. */
2675  elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend] = elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i];
2676  ranksSendMPI[level][nRankSend] = ranksSend[i];
2677 
2678  /* Determine the size of the send buffer and allocate the memory. */
2679  unsigned long sizeBuf = 0;
2680  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend].size(); ++j) {
2681  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend][j];
2682  sizeBuf += volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
2683  }
2684 
2685  sizeBuf *= nItemsPerDOF;
2686  commSendBuf[level][nRankSend].resize(sizeBuf);
2687 
2688  /* Update nRankSend. */
2689  ++nRankSend;
2690  }
2691  }
2692  }
2693 
2694 #endif
2695 
2696  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2697  /*--- Step 4. Store the information for the rotational periodic ---*/
2698  /*--- corrections for the halo elements. ---*/
2699  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2700 
2701  /* Get the data for the rotational periodic halos from FEMGeometry. */
2702  const vector<unsigned short> &markersRotPer = FEMGeometry->GetRotPerMarkers();
2703  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &rotPerHalos = FEMGeometry->GetRotPerHalos();
2704 
2705  /* Allocate the memory for the first and second index of
2706  halosRotationalPeriodicity. Also allocate the memory to store the
2707  rotation matrices of the periodic transformations. */
2708  const unsigned short nRotPerMarkers = markersRotPer.size();
2709  halosRotationalPeriodicity.resize(nTimeLevels);
2710  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2711  halosRotationalPeriodicity[i].resize(nRotPerMarkers);
2712 
2713  rotationMatricesPeriodicity.resize(9*nRotPerMarkers);
2714 
2715  /* Loop over the rotational periodic transformations. */
2716  unsigned int ii = 0;
2717  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nRotPerMarkers; ++i) {
2718 
2719  /* Get the rotation angles from config for this marker. */
2720  const unsigned short pInd = markersRotPer[i];
2721  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(pInd));
2722 
2723  /*--- Determine the rotation matrix from the donor to the halo elements.
2724  This is the transpose of the rotation matrix from the halo to the
2725  donor elements, which is stored in periodic angles of the marker. ---*/
2726  const su2double theta = angles[0], phi = angles[1], psi = angles[2];
2727 
2728  const su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
2729  const su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
2730 
2731  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosPhi*cosPsi;
2732  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosPhi*sinPsi;
2733  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = -sinPhi;
2734 
2735  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi - cosTheta*sinPsi;
2736  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi + cosTheta*cosPsi;
2737  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*cosPhi;
2738 
2739  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi + sinTheta*sinPsi;
2740  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi - sinTheta*cosPsi;
2741  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*cosPhi;
2742 
2743  /* Loop over the elements of this periodic transformation and store them
2744  in the appropriate location of halosRotationalPeriodicity. */
2745  for(unsigned long j=0; j<rotPerHalos[i].size(); ++j) {
2746  const unsigned long jj = rotPerHalos[i][j];
2747  halosRotationalPeriodicity[volElem[jj].timeLevel][i].push_back(jj);
2748  }
2749  }
2750 }
2751 
2752 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Initiate_MPI_Communication(CConfig *config,
2753  const unsigned short timeLevel) {
2754 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2755 
2756  /* Check if there is anything to communicate. */
2757  if( commRequests[timeLevel].size() ) {
2758 
2759  /* Set the pointer to the memory, whose data must be communicated.
2760  This depends on the time integration scheme used. For ADER the data of
2761  the predictor part is communicated, while for the other time integration
2762  schemes typically the working solution is communicated. Note that if the
2763  working solution is communicated, there is only one time level. */
2764  unsigned short nTimeDOFs;
2765  su2double *commData;
2766  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
2767  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2768  commData = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data();
2769  }
2770  else {
2771  nTimeDOFs = 1;
2772  commData = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
2773  }
2774 
2775  /* Loop over the number of ranks to which this rank must send data. */
2776  int indComm = 0;
2777  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
2778  unsigned long ii = 0;
2779 
2780  /* Loop over the elements to be sent and copy the solution data
2781  into the send buffer. */
2782  su2double *sendBuf = commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
2783  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
2784  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
2785  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2786 
2787  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
2788  const unsigned long indS = nVar*(volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal + k*nDOFsLocTot);
2789  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2790  sendBuf[ii+mm] = commData[indS+mm];
2791  ii += nItems;
2792  }
2793  }
2794 
2795  /* Send the data using non-blocking sends. */
2796  int dest = ranksSendMPI[timeLevel][i];
2797  int tag = dest + timeLevel;
2798  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf, ii, MPI_DOUBLE, dest, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2799  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
2800  }
2801 
2802  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which data is received. */
2803  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
2804 
2805  /* Post the non-blocking receive. */
2806  int source = ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel][i];
2807  int tag = rank + timeLevel;
2808  SU2_MPI::Irecv(commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data(),
2809  commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].size(),
2810  MPI_DOUBLE, source, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2811  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
2812  }
2813  }
2814 
2815 #endif
2816 }
2817 
2818 bool CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Complete_MPI_Communication(CConfig *config,
2819  const unsigned short timeLevel,
2820  const bool commMustBeCompleted) {
2821 
2822  /* Set the pointer to the memory, whose data must be communicated.
2823  This depends on the time integration scheme used. For ADER the data of
2824  the predictor part is communicated, while for the other time integration
2825  schemes typically the working solution is communicated. Note that if the
2826  working solution is communicated, there is only one time level. */
2827  unsigned short nTimeDOFs;
2828  su2double *commData;
2829  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
2830  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2831  commData = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data();
2832  }
2833  else {
2834  nTimeDOFs = 1;
2835  commData = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
2836  }
2837 
2838  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2839  /*--- Complete the MPI communication, if needed and if possible, and ---*/
2840  /*--- copy the data from the receive buffers into the correct ---*/
2841  /*--- location in commData. ---*/
2842  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2843 
2844 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2845  if( commRequests[timeLevel].size() ) {
2846 
2847  /*--- There are communication requests to be completed. Check if these
2848  requests must be completed. In that case Waitall is used.
2849  Otherwise, Testall is used to check if all the requests have
2850  been completed. If not, false is returned. ---*/
2851  if( commMustBeCompleted ) {
2852  SU2_MPI::Waitall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
2853  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2854  }
2855  else {
2856  int flag;
2857  SU2_MPI::Testall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
2858  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), &flag, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2859  if( !flag ) return false;
2860  }
2861 
2862  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank has received data. */
2863  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
2864  unsigned long ii = 0;
2865 
2866  /* Loop over the elements to be received and copy the solution data
2867  into commData. */
2868  su2double *recvBuf = commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
2869  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
2870  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
2871  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2872 
2873  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
2874  const unsigned long indR = nVar*(volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal + k*nDOFsLocTot);
2875  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2876  commData[indR+mm] = recvBuf[ii+mm];
2877  ii += nItems;
2878  }
2879  }
2880  }
2881  }
2882 #endif
2883 
2884  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2885  /*--- Carry out the self communication. ---*/
2886  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2887 
2888  /* Loop over the number of elements involved and copy the data of the DOFs. */
2889  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
2890  const unsigned long elemS = elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
2891  const unsigned long elemR = elementsRecvSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
2892  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[elemS].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2893 
2894  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
2895  const unsigned long indS = nVar*(volElem[elemS].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j*nDOFsLocTot);
2896  const unsigned long indR = nVar*(volElem[elemR].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j*nDOFsLocTot);
2897 
2898  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2899  commData[indR+mm] = commData[indS+mm];
2900  }
2901  }
2902 
2903  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2904  /*--- Correct the vector quantities in the rotational periodic halo's. ---*/
2905  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2906 
2907  /*--- Loop over the markers for which a rotational periodic
2908  correction must be applied to the momentum variables. ---*/
2909  unsigned int ii = 0;
2910  const unsigned long nRotPerMarkers = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel].size();
2911  for(unsigned long k=0; k<nRotPerMarkers; ++k) {
2912 
2913  /* Easier storage of the rotational matrix. */
2914  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2915 
2916  rotMatrix[0][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2917  rotMatrix[0][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2918  rotMatrix[0][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2919 
2920  rotMatrix[1][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2921  rotMatrix[1][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2922  rotMatrix[1][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2923 
2924  rotMatrix[2][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2925  rotMatrix[2][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2926  rotMatrix[2][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2927 
2928  /* Determine the number of elements for this transformation and
2929  loop over them. */
2930  const unsigned long nHaloElem = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k].size();
2931  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nHaloElem; ++j) {
2932 
2933  /* Easier storage of the halo index and loop over its DOFs, including
2934  the multiple time DOFs for ADER. */
2935  for(unsigned short tInd=0; tInd<nTimeDOFs; ++tInd) {
2936  const unsigned long tIndOff = tInd*nDOFsLocTot;
2937  const unsigned long ind = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k][j];
2938  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ind].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
2939 
2940  /* Determine the pointer in commData where the solution of this DOF
2941  is stored and copy the momentum variables. Note that a rotational
2942  correction can only take place for a 3D simulation. */
2943  su2double *sol = commData + nVar*(volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i + tIndOff);
2944 
2945  const su2double ru = sol[1], rv = sol[2], rw = sol[3];
2946 
2947  /* Correct the momentum variables. */
2948  sol[1] = rotMatrix[0][0]*ru + rotMatrix[0][1]*rv + rotMatrix[0][2]*rw;
2949  sol[2] = rotMatrix[1][0]*ru + rotMatrix[1][1]*rv + rotMatrix[1][2]*rw;
2950  sol[3] = rotMatrix[2][0]*ru + rotMatrix[2][1]*rv + rotMatrix[2][2]*rw;
2951  }
2952  }
2953  }
2954  }
2955 
2956  /* Return true to indicate that the communication has been completed. */
2957  return true;
2958 }
2959 
2960 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Initiate_MPI_ReverseCommunication(CConfig *config,
2961  const unsigned short timeLevel) {
2962 
2963  /* Set the pointer to the residual to be communicated. */
2964  su2double *resComm;
2965  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) resComm = VecTotResDOFsADER.data();
2966  else resComm = VecResDOFs.data();
2967 
2968  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2969  /*--- Correct the vector residuals in the rotational periodic halo's. ---*/
2970  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2971 
2972  /*--- Loop over the markers for which a rotational periodic
2973  correction must be applied to the momentum variables. ---*/
2974  unsigned int ii = 0;
2975  const unsigned short nRotPerMarkers = halosRotationalPeriodicity[0].size();
2976  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nRotPerMarkers; ++k) {
2977 
2978  /* Easier storage of the transpose of the rotational matrix. */
2979  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2980 
2981  rotMatrix[0][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2982  rotMatrix[1][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2983  rotMatrix[2][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2984 
2985  rotMatrix[0][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2986  rotMatrix[1][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2987  rotMatrix[2][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2988 
2989  rotMatrix[0][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2990  rotMatrix[1][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2991  rotMatrix[2][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2992 
2993  /* Determine the number of elements for this transformation and
2994  loop over them. */
2995  const unsigned long nHaloElem = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k].size();
2996  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nHaloElem; ++j) {
2997 
2998  /* Easier storage of the halo index and loop over its DOFs. */
2999  const unsigned long ind = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k][j];
3000  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ind].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3001 
3002  /* Determine the pointer in VecResDOFs where the residual of this DOF
3003  is stored and copy the momentum residuals. Note that a rotational
3004  correction can only take place for a 3D simulation. */
3005  su2double *res = resComm + nVar*(volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i);
3006 
3007  const su2double ru = res[1], rv = res[2], rw = res[3];
3008 
3009  /* Correct the momentum variables. */
3010  res[1] = rotMatrix[0][0]*ru + rotMatrix[0][1]*rv + rotMatrix[0][2]*rw;
3011  res[2] = rotMatrix[1][0]*ru + rotMatrix[1][1]*rv + rotMatrix[1][2]*rw;
3012  res[3] = rotMatrix[2][0]*ru + rotMatrix[2][1]*rv + rotMatrix[2][2]*rw;
3013  }
3014  }
3015  }
3016 
3017 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3018 
3019  /* Check if there is anything to communicate. */
3020  if( commRequests[timeLevel].size() ) {
3021 
3022  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives data in
3023  the original communication pattern. In the reverse pattern, data
3024  has to be sent. */
3025  int indComm = 0;
3026  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
3027  unsigned long ii = 0;
3028 
3029  /* Loop over the elements copy the residual data into recvBuf. */
3030  su2double *recvBuf = commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
3031  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
3032  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
3033  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
3034 
3035  const unsigned long indS = nVar*volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3036  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
3037  recvBuf[ii+mm] = resComm[indS+mm];
3038  ii += nItems;
3039  }
3040 
3041  /* Send the data using non-blocking sends. */
3042  int dest = ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel][i];
3043  int tag = dest + timeLevel + 20;
3044  SU2_MPI::Isend(recvBuf, ii, MPI_DOUBLE, dest, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3045  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
3046  }
3047 
3048  /* Post the non-blocking receives. As this is the reverse communication,
3049  a loop over the sending ranks must be carried out. */
3050  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
3051 
3052  int source = ranksSendMPI[timeLevel][i];
3053  int tag = rank + timeLevel + 20;
3054  SU2_MPI::Irecv(commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data(),
3055  commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].size(),
3056  MPI_DOUBLE, source, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3057  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
3058  }
3059  }
3060 
3061 #endif
3062 
3063 }
3064 
3065 bool CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Complete_MPI_ReverseCommunication(CConfig *config,
3066  const unsigned short timeLevel,
3067  const bool commMustBeCompleted) {
3068  /* Set the pointer to the residual to be communicated. */
3069  su2double *resComm;
3070  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) resComm = VecTotResDOFsADER.data();
3071  else resComm = VecResDOFs.data();
3072 
3073 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3074 
3075  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3076  /*--- Complete the MPI communication, if needed and if possible. ---*/
3077  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3078 
3079  /* Check if there are any requests to complete for this time level. */
3080  if( commRequests[timeLevel].size() ) {
3081 
3082  /*--- There are communication requests to be completed. Check if these
3083  requests must be completed. In that case Waitall is used.
3084  Otherwise, Testall is used to check if all the requests have
3085  been completed. If not, return false. ---*/
3086  if( commMustBeCompleted ) {
3087  SU2_MPI::Waitall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
3088  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3089  }
3090  else {
3091  int flag;
3092  SU2_MPI::Testall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
3093  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), &flag, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3094  if( !flag ) return false;
3095  }
3096 
3097  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3098  /*--- Update the residuals of the owned DOFs with the data received. ---*/
3099  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3100 
3101  /*--- Loop over the received residual data from all ranks and update the
3102  residual of the DOFs of the corresponding elements. Note that in
3103  reverse mode the send communication data must be used. ---*/
3104  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
3105 
3106  /* Loop over the elements that must be updated. */
3107  unsigned long nn = 0;
3108  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
3109  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
3110 
3111  /* Easier storage of the starting residual of this element and the
3112  data in the buffer and update the residuals of the DOFs. */
3113  const unsigned short nRes = nVar*volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
3114  su2double *res = resComm + nVar*volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3115  const su2double *buf = commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data() + nn;
3116 
3117  nn += nRes;
3118  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nRes; ++k)
3119  res[k] += buf[k];
3120  }
3121  }
3122  }
3123 
3124 #endif
3125 
3126  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3127  /*--- Carry out the self communication. ---*/
3128  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3129 
3130  /*--- Loop over the number of elements involved and update the residuals
3131  of the owned DOFs. ---*/
3132  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
3133 
3134  const unsigned long volOwned = elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
3135  const unsigned long volHalo = elementsRecvSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
3136  su2double *resOwned = resComm + nVar*volElem[volOwned].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3137  su2double *resHalo = resComm + nVar*volElem[volHalo].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3138 
3139  const unsigned short nRes = nVar*volElem[volOwned].nDOFsSol;
3140  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nRes; ++j)
3141  resOwned[j] += resHalo[j];
3142  }
3143 
3144  /* Initialize the halo residuals of the just completed communication pattern
3145  to zero if ADER-DG is used. */
3146  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
3147  const unsigned long iBeg = nVar*volElem[nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel]].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3148  const unsigned long volIndEnd = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1]-1;
3149  const unsigned long iEnd = nVar*(volElem[volIndEnd].offsetDOFsSolLocal
3150  + volElem[volIndEnd].nDOFsSol);
3151 
3152  for(unsigned long i=iBeg; i<iEnd; ++i)
3153  VecTotResDOFsADER[i] = 0.0;
3154  }
3155 
3156  /* Return true to indicate that the communication has been completed. */
3157  return true;
3158 }
3159 
3160 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetInitialCondition(CGeometry **geometry, CSolver ***solver_container, CConfig *config, unsigned long TimeIter) {
3161 
3162  /*--- Check if a verification solution is to be computed. ---*/
3163  if ((VerificationSolution) && (TimeIter == 0)) {
3164 
3165  /* Loop over the owned elements. */
3166  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
3167 
3168  /* Loop over the DOFs of this element. */
3169  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[i].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
3170 
3171  /* Set the pointers to the coordinates and solution of this DOF. */
3172  const su2double *coor = volElem[i].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
3173  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*(volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j);
3174 
3175  /* Set the solution in this DOF to the initial condition provided by
3176  the verification solution class. This can be the exact solution,
3177  but this is not necessary. */
3178  VerificationSolution->GetInitialCondition(coor, solDOF);
3179  }
3180  }
3181  }
3182 }
3183 
3184 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Preprocessing(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container, CConfig *config, unsigned short iMesh, unsigned short iStep, unsigned short RunTime_EqSystem, bool Output) {
3185 
3186  unsigned long ErrorCounter = 0;
3187 
3188  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3189  /*--- Check for non-physical points. Only needed for a compressible solver. ---*/
3190  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3191 
3192  if(config->GetKind_Regime() == ENUM_REGIME::COMPRESSIBLE) {
3193 
3194  /*--- Make a distinction between 2D and 3D for optimal performance. ---*/
3195  switch( nDim ) {
3196 
3197  case 2: {
3198  /*--- 2D simulation. Loop over the owned DOFs and check for
3199  non-physical solutions. If found, the state is overwritten with
3200  the free-stream values. This usually does not work. ---*/
3201  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
3202  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
3203  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/solDOF[0];
3204  const su2double Mom2 = solDOF[1]*solDOF[1] + solDOF[2]*solDOF[2];
3205  const su2double StaticEnergy = DensityInv*(solDOF[3] - 0.5*DensityInv*Mom2);
3206 
3207  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(solDOF[0], StaticEnergy);
3208  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
3209  const su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
3210 
3211  if((Pressure < 0.0) || (solDOF[0] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
3212  ++ErrorCounter;
3213 
3214  solDOF[0] = ConsVarFreeStream[0]; solDOF[1] = ConsVarFreeStream[1];
3215  solDOF[2] = ConsVarFreeStream[2]; solDOF[3] = ConsVarFreeStream[3];
3216  }
3217  }
3218 
3219  break;
3220  }
3221 
3222  case 3: {
3223  /*--- 3D simulation. Loop over the owned DOFs and check for
3224  non-physical solutions. If found, the state is overwritten with
3225  the free-stream values. This usually does not work. ---*/
3226  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
3227  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
3228  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/solDOF[0];
3229  const su2double Mom2 = solDOF[1]*solDOF[1] + solDOF[2]*solDOF[2]
3230  + solDOF[3]*solDOF[3];
3231  const su2double StaticEnergy = DensityInv*(solDOF[4] - 0.5*DensityInv*Mom2);
3232 
3233  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(solDOF[0], StaticEnergy);
3234  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
3235  const su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
3236 
3237  if((Pressure < 0.0) || (solDOF[0] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
3238  ++ErrorCounter;
3239 
3240  solDOF[0] = ConsVarFreeStream[0]; solDOF[1] = ConsVarFreeStream[1];
3241  solDOF[2] = ConsVarFreeStream[2]; solDOF[3] = ConsVarFreeStream[3];
3242  solDOF[4] = ConsVarFreeStream[4];
3243  }
3244  }
3245 
3246  break;
3247  }
3248  }
3249 
3250  /*--- Collect the number of non-physical points for this iteration. ---*/
3251  if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
3252 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3253  unsigned long MyErrorCounter = ErrorCounter;
3254  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&MyErrorCounter, &ErrorCounter, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3255 #endif
3256  if (iMesh == MESH_0) config->SetNonphysical_Points(ErrorCounter);
3257  }
3258  }
3259 
3260  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3261  /* Check for grid motion. */
3262  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3263 
3264  const bool harmonic_balance = config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::HARMONIC_BALANCE;
3265  if(config->GetGrid_Movement() && !harmonic_balance) {
3266 
3267  /*--- Determine the type of grid motion. ---*/
3268  switch( config->GetKind_GridMovement() ) {
3269 
3270  case ROTATING_FRAME:
3271  case STEADY_TRANSLATION: {
3272 
3273  /* Steady motion. This is accounted for in the general preprocessing,
3274  where grid velocities are computed. */
3275  break;
3276  }
3277 
3278  case RIGID_MOTION: {
3279 
3280  /* Rigid body motion described. At the moment this is only
3281  possible for the Classical Runge Kutta scheme. */
3282  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme() != CLASSICAL_RK4_EXPLICIT)
3283  SU2_MPI::Error("Rigid body motion only possible for CLASSICAL_RK4_EXPLICIT.",
3284  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3285 
3286  /* Determine whether or not it is needed to compute the motion data. */
3287  const unsigned long TimeIter = config->GetTimeIter();
3288 
3289  bool computeMotion = false, firstTime = false;
3290  if(TimeIter == 0 && iStep == 0) computeMotion = firstTime = true;
3291  if(iStep == 1 || iStep == 3) computeMotion = true;
3292 
3293  if( computeMotion ) {
3294 
3295  /* Determine the number of time levels. For the classical Runge-Kutta
3296  scheme this should be 1. */
3297  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
3298 
3299  /* Determine the time for which the motion data must be determined. */
3300  const su2double deltaT = config->GetDelta_UnstTimeND();
3301 
3302  su2double tNew = TimeIter*deltaT;
3303  if( iStep ) tNew += 0.25*(iStep+1)*deltaT;
3304 
3305  /* Determine the time for which the currently stored position was
3306  calculated. */
3307  const su2double tOld = tNew - 0.5*deltaT;
3308 
3309  /* Hard code the plunging motion in y-direction. */
3310  const su2double b2New = 0.25*tNew*tNew*(3.0-tNew);
3311  const su2double db2Newdt = 0.75*tNew*(2.0-tNew);
3312 
3313  const su2double b2Old = 0.25*tOld*tOld*(3.0-tOld);
3314  const su2double dB2 = b2New - b2Old;
3315 
3316  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3317  /*--- Update the coordinates of the DOFs (both grid and solution) ---*/
3318  /*--- and of the integration points (volume and surfaces). ---*/
3319  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3320 
3321  /* The coordinates must be updated if this is not the first
3322  first stage of the first time step. */
3323  if( !firstTime ) {
3324 
3325  /* Adapt the coordinates of the grid points. */
3326  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMeshPoints; ++l)
3327  meshPoints[l].coor[1] += dB2;
3328 
3329  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
3330  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
3331 
3332  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
3333  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
3334  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3335 
3336  /* Adapt the coordinates of the volume integration points. */
3337  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3338  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3339  coor[1] += dB2;
3340  }
3341 
3342  /* Adapt the coordinates of the solution DOFs. */
3343  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3344  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
3345  coor[1] += dB2;
3346  }
3347  }
3348 
3349  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
3350  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]; ++l) {
3351 
3352  /* Get the required information from the standard element. */
3353  const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[l].indStandardElement;
3354  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3355 
3356  /* Adapt the coordinates of the surface integration points. */
3357  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3358  su2double *coor = matchingInternalFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3359  coor[1] += dB2;
3360  }
3361  }
3362 
3363  /* The physical boundary faces. Exclude the periodic boundaries,
3364  because these are not physical boundaries. */
3365  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3366 
3367  if( !(boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) ) {
3368 
3369  /* Easier storage of the variables for this boundary. */
3370  const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
3371  CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
3372 
3373  /*--- Loop over the surface elements and update the coordinates of
3374  the integration points. ---*/
3375  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem; ++l) {
3376  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
3377  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3378 
3379  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3380  su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3381  coor[1] += dB2;
3382  }
3383  }
3384  }
3385  }
3386  }
3387 
3388  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3389  /*--- Compute the grid velocities of the volume solution DOFs and ---*/
3390  /*--- and of the integration points (volume and surfaces). ---*/
3391  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3392 
3393  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
3394  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
3395 
3396  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
3397  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
3398  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3399 
3400  /* Compute the grid velocity in the integration points. */
3401  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3402  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3403  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3404  }
3405 
3406  /* Compute the grid velocities for the solution DOFs. */
3407  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3408  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
3409  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3410  }
3411  }
3412 
3413  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
3414  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]; ++l) {
3415 
3416  /* Get the required information from the standard element. */
3417  const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[l].indStandardElement;
3418  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3419 
3420  /* Compute the grid velocity in the integration points. */
3421  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3422  su2double *gridVel = matchingInternalFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3423  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3424  }
3425  }
3426 
3427  /* The physical boundary faces. Exclude the periodic boundaries,
3428  because these are not physical boundaries. */
3429  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3430 
3431  if( !(boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) ) {
3432 
3433  /* Easier storage of the variables for this boundary. */
3434  const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
3435  CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
3436 
3437  /*--- Loop over the surface elements and compute the grid velocities
3438  of the integration points. ---*/
3439  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem; ++l) {
3440  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
3441  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3442 
3443  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3444  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3445  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3446  }
3447  }
3448  }
3449  }
3450  }
3451 
3452  break;
3453  }
3454 
3455  default: {
3456  SU2_MPI::Error("Only rigid body motion possible for DG-FEM solver at the moment.",
3457  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3458  }
3459  }
3460  }
3461 }
3462 
3463 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Postprocessing(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container, CConfig *config,
3464  unsigned short iMesh) { }
3465 
3466 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeSpatialJacobian(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
3467  CNumerics **numerics, CConfig *config,
3468  unsigned short iMesh, unsigned short RunTime_EqSystem) {
3469 
3470  /* Write a message that the Jacobian is being computed. */
3471  if(rank == MASTER_NODE) {
3472  cout << endl;
3473  cout << "Computing the Jacobian via coloring." << endl;
3474  cout << endl << flush;
3475  }
3476 
3477  /* Easier storage of the number of variables squared. */
3478  const unsigned short nVar2 = nVar*nVar;
3479 
3480  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3481  /*--- Step 1: Computation of the actual Jacobian by looping over the ---*/
3482  /*--- of colors and disturbing the appropriate DOFs for each ---*/
3483  /*--- color. Note that for each color an additional loop over ---*/
3484  /*--- the number of variables is needed to create the Jacobian. ---*/
3485  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3486 
3487  /* Determine the number of non-zeros in the Jacobian matrix for the owned
3488  DOFs in cumulative storage format. */
3489  vector<unsigned long> nNonZeroEntries(nDOFsLocOwned+1);
3490 
3491  nNonZeroEntries[0] = 0;
3492  for(unsigned i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i)
3493  nNonZeroEntries[i+1] = nNonZeroEntries[i] + nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i].size();
3494 
3495  /* Copy the solution into the working variables. */
3496  Set_OldSolution();
3497 
3498  /* Allocate the memory for local part of the Jacobian. Note that passivedouble
3499  must be used for the Jacobian matrix. */
3500  vector<passivedouble> Jacobian(nVar2*nNonZeroEntries[nDOFsLocOwned]);
3501 
3502  /* Loop over the colors and write a message, if needed. */
3503  for(int color=0; color<nGlobalColors; ++color) {
3504 
3505  if(rank == MASTER_NODE && !(color%10)) {
3506  cout << "Color " << color+1 << " out of " << nGlobalColors
3507  << " is computed" << endl;
3508  }
3509 
3510  /* Loop over the number of variables. */
3511  for(short var=0; var<nVar; ++var) {
3512 
3513  /* Loop over the DOFs that must be disturbed for this color. */
3514  for(unsigned long j=0; j<localDOFsPerColor[color].size(); ++j) {
3515  const unsigned long jj = localDOFsPerColor[color][j];
3516 
3517  su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data() + jj*nVar;
3518 
3519 #ifdef CODI_FORWARD_TYPE
3520  solDOF[var].setGradient(1.0);
3521 #else
3522  solDOF[var] += 0.001; /* This is to avoid a compiler warning. */
3523 #endif
3524  }
3525 
3526  /* Carry out all the tasks to compute the residual. */
