5344  INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5345  const su2double *gridVel = elem->gridVelocities.data() + 2*i; /* nDim*i. */
5346 
5347  /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5348  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5349  THE DATA FOR THIS SPATIAL INTEGRATION POINT FOR THE CURRENT TIME
5350  INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5351  const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5352 
5353  const su2double drdx = metricTerms[1];
5354  const su2double drdy = metricTerms[2];
5355  const su2double dsdx = metricTerms[3];
5356  const su2double dsdy = metricTerms[4];
5357 
5358  /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the independent solution
5359  variables from the gradients in parametric coordinates and the
5360  metric terms in this integration point. Note that these gradients
5361  must be scaled with the Jacobian. This scaling is already present
5362  in the metric terms. */
5363  const su2double drhodx = solDr[0]*drdx + solDs[0]*dsdx;
5364  const su2double drudx = solDr[1]*drdx + solDs[1]*dsdx;
5365  const su2double drvdx = solDr[2]*drdx + solDs[2]*dsdx;
5366  const su2double drEdx = solDr[3]*drdx + solDs[3]*dsdx;
5367 
5368  const su2double drhody = solDr[0]*drdy + solDs[0]*dsdy;
5369  const su2double drudy = solDr[1]*drdy + solDs[1]*dsdy;
5370  const su2double drvdy = solDr[2]*drdy + solDs[2]*dsdy;
5371  const su2double drEdy = solDr[3]*drdy + solDs[3]*dsdy;
5372 
5373  /*--- Compute the divergence of the grid velocity.
5374  SET TO ZERO FOR NOW. THIS IS NOT CORRECT!!!!. ---*/
5375  const su2double divGridVel = 0.0; // Must be multiplied by the Jacobian.
5376 
5377  /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the pressure, scaled with
5378  the Jacobian. */
5379  const su2double dpdx = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdx + kinEnergy*drhodx
5380  - u*drudx - v*drvdx);
5381  const su2double dpdy = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdy + kinEnergy*drhody
5382  - u*drudy - v*drvdy);
5383 
5384  /* Abbreviations, which make it easier to compute the divergence term. */
5385  const su2double abv1 = drudx + drvdy;
5386  const su2double abv2 = u* drhodx + v*drhody;
5387  const su2double abv3 = u*(drEdx + dpdx) + v*(drEdy + dpdy);
5388 
5389  /* Compute the divergence terms for this integration point,
5390  multiplied by the integration weight. */
5391  divFluxInt[0] = weights[i]*(abv1 - rho*divGridVel
5392  - gridVel[0]*drhodx - gridVel[1]*drhody);
5393  divFluxInt[1] = weights[i]*(dpdx + u*(abv1 - abv2 + drudx) + v*drudy
5394  - ru*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drudx - gridVel[1]*drudy);
5395  divFluxInt[2] = weights[i]*(dpdy + v*(abv1 - abv2 + drvdy) + u*drvdx
5396  - rv*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drvdx - gridVel[1]*drvdy);
5397  divFluxInt[3] = weights[i]*(abv3 + Htot*(abv1 - abv2) - rE*divGridVel
5398  - gridVel[0]*drEdx - gridVel[1]*drEdy);
5399 
5400  /* Add the body force to the flux divergence for the momentum and energy
5401  equation. Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
5402  integration weight in order to be consistent with the formulation of
5403  the residual. Also note that for the energy source term the absolute
5404  velocity must be taken and not the relative. */
5405  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5406 
5407  divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*bodyForceX;
5408  divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*bodyForceY;
5409  divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*(u*bodyForceX + v*bodyForceY);
5410  }
5411  }
5412 
5413  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5414  /*--- Add the source terms of the manufactured solution to the divergence---*/
5415  /*--- of the fluxes, if a manufactured solution is used. ---*/
5416  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5417 
5418  if( VerificationSolution ) {
5419  if( VerificationSolution->IsManufacturedSolution() ) {
5420 
5421  /*--- Loop over the number of entities that are treated simultaneously. */
5422  for(unsigned short simul=0; simul<nSimul; ++simul) {
5423 
5424  /*--- Loop over the integration points of the element. ---*/
5425  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5426 
5427  /* Set the pointers for this integration point. */
5428  const unsigned short offInt = i*NPad + simul*nVar;
5429  su2double *divFluxInt = divFlux + offInt;
5430 
5431  /* Set the pointer to the coordinates in this integration point.
5432  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5433  THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5434  BE TAKEN. */
5435  const su2double *coor = elem->coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
5436 
5437  /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5438  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5439  THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5440  BE TAKEN. */
5441  const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5442  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5443 
5444  /* Compute the source terms of the manufactured solution.
5445  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. FOR AN ACTUAL TIME ACCURATE
5446  SIMULATION THE CORRECT TIME MUST BE GIVEN TO THIS FUNCTION. */
5447  su2double sourceMan[4];
5448  VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, 0.0, sourceMan);
5449 
5450  /* Add the source terms to the flux divergence. Note that the source
5451  terms are multiplied with minus the integration weight in order
5452  to be consistent with the formulation of the residual. */
5453  divFluxInt[0] -= weightJac*sourceMan[0];
5454  divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*sourceMan[1];
5455  divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*sourceMan[2];
5456  divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*sourceMan[3];
5457  }
5458  }
5459  }
5460  }
5461 
5462  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5463  /*--- Compute the residual in the DOFs, which is the matrix product of ---*/
5464  /*--- basisFunctionsIntTrans and divFlux. ---*/
5465  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5466 
5467  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFunctionsIntTrans, divFlux, res, config);
5468 }
5469 
5470 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_NonAliasedPredictorResidual_3D(CConfig *config,
5471  CVolumeElementFEM *elem,
5472  const su2double *sol,
5473  const unsigned short nSimul,
5474  const unsigned short NPad,
5475  su2double *res,
5476  su2double *work) {
5477 
5478  /* Set the pointers for solAndGradInt and divFlux to work. The same array
5479  can be used for both help arrays. */
5480  su2double *solAndGradInt = work;
5481  su2double *divFlux = work;
5482 
5483  /*--- Get the necessary information from the standard element. ---*/
5484  const unsigned short ind = elem->indStandardElement;
5485  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5486  const unsigned short nDOFs = elem->nDOFsSol;
5487  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5488  const su2double *basisFunctionsIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegrationTrans();
5489  const su2double *weights = standardElementsSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
5490 
5491  /* Check if a body force is present and set it accordingly. */
5492  su2double bodyForceX = 0.0, bodyForceY = 0.0, bodyForceZ = 0.0;
5493  if( config->GetBody_Force() ) {
5494  const su2double *body_force_vector = config->GetBody_Force_Vector();
5495  bodyForceX = body_force_vector[0];
5496  bodyForceY = body_force_vector[1];
5497  bodyForceZ = body_force_vector[2];
5498  }
5499 
5500  /* Determine the offset between the solution variables and the r-derivatives,
5501  which is also the offset between the r- and s-derivatives and the offset
5502  between s- and t-derivatives. */
5503  const unsigned short offDeriv = NPad*nInt;
5504 
5505  /* Store the number of metric points per integration point for readability. */
5506  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = 10; /* nDim*nDim + 1. */
5507 
5508  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5509  /*--- Compute the solution and the derivatives w.r.t. the parametric ---*/
5510  /*--- coordinates in the integration points. The first argument in ---*/
5511  /*--- the call to blasFunctions->gemm is nInt*(nDim+1). ---*/
5512  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5513 
5514  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt*4, NPad, nDOFs, matBasisInt, sol, solAndGradInt, config);
5515 
5516  /*--- Loop over the number of entities that are treated simultaneously. */
5517  for(unsigned short simul=0; simul<nSimul; ++simul) {
5518 
5519  /* Set the pointers to the location where the solution and the divergence
5520  of the 1st DOF of this entity is stored, such that this offset does not
5521  need to be taken into account anymore in the loop over the integration
5522  points below. */
5523  const su2double *solAndGradEntity = solAndGradInt + simul*nVar;
5524  su2double *divFluxEntity = divFlux + simul*nVar;
5525 
5526  /*--- Loop over the integration points. ---*/
5527  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5528 
5529  /* Easier storage of the location where the solution and gradient data
5530  of this integration point starts. */
5531  const su2double *sol = solAndGradEntity + NPad*i;
5532  const su2double *solDr = sol + offDeriv;
5533  const su2double *solDs = solDr + offDeriv;
5534  const su2double *solDt = solDs + offDeriv;
5535  su2double *divFluxInt = divFluxEntity + NPad*i;
5536 
5537  /*--- Compute the velocities, pressure and total enthalpy
5538  in this integration point. ---*/
5539  const su2double rho = sol[0];
5540  const su2double ru = sol[1];
5541  const su2double rv = sol[2];
5542  const su2double rw = sol[3];
5543  const su2double rE = sol[4];
5544 
5545  const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/rho;
5546  const su2double u = rhoInv*ru;
5547  const su2double v = rhoInv*rv;
5548  const su2double w = rhoInv*rw;
5549  const su2double kinEnergy = 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
5550  const su2double StaticEnergy = rhoInv*rE - kinEnergy;
5551 
5552  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(rho, StaticEnergy);
5553  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
5554  const su2double Htot = rhoInv*(rE + Pressure);
5555 
5556  /* Set the pointer to the grid velocities in this integration point.
5557  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5558  THE DATA FOR THIS SPATIAL INTEGRATION POINT FOR THE CURRENT TIME
5559  INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5560  const su2double *gridVel = elem->gridVelocities.data() + 3*i; /* nDim*i. */
5561 
5562  /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5563  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5564  THE DATA FOR THIS SPATIAL INTEGRATION POINT FOR THE CURRENT TIME
5565  INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5566  const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5567 
5568  const su2double drdx = metricTerms[1];
5569  const su2double drdy = metricTerms[2];
5570  const su2double drdz = metricTerms[3];
5571 
5572  const su2double dsdx = metricTerms[4];
5573  const su2double dsdy = metricTerms[5];
5574  const su2double dsdz = metricTerms[6];
5575 
5576  const su2double dtdx = metricTerms[7];
5577  const su2double dtdy = metricTerms[8];
5578  const su2double dtdz = metricTerms[9];
5579 
5580  /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the independent solution
5581  variables from the gradients in parametric coordinates and the
5582  metric terms in this integration point. Note that these gradients
5583  must be scaled with the Jacobian. This scaling is already present
5584  in the metric terms. */
5585  const su2double drhodx = solDr[0]*drdx + solDs[0]*dsdx + solDt[0]*dtdx;
5586  const su2double drudx = solDr[1]*drdx + solDs[1]*dsdx + solDt[1]*dtdx;
5587  const su2double drvdx = solDr[2]*drdx + solDs[2]*dsdx + solDt[2]*dtdx;
5588  const su2double drwdx = solDr[3]*drdx + solDs[3]*dsdx + solDt[3]*dtdx;
5589  const su2double drEdx = solDr[4]*drdx + solDs[4]*dsdx + solDt[4]*dtdx;
5590 
5591  const su2double drhody = solDr[0]*drdy + solDs[0]*dsdy + solDs[0]*dtdy;
5592  const su2double drudy = solDr[1]*drdy + solDs[1]*dsdy + solDs[1]*dtdy;
5593  const su2double drvdy = solDr[2]*drdy + solDs[2]*dsdy + solDs[2]*dtdy;
5594  const su2double drwdy = solDr[3]*drdy + solDs[3]*dsdy + solDs[3]*dtdy;
5595  const su2double drEdy = solDr[4]*drdy + solDs[4]*dsdy + solDs[4]*dtdy;
5596 
5597  const su2double drhodz = solDr[0]*drdz + solDs[0]*dsdz + solDs[0]*dtdz;
5598  const su2double drudz = solDr[1]*drdz + solDs[1]*dsdz + solDs[1]*dtdz;
5599  const su2double drvdz = solDr[2]*drdz + solDs[2]*dsdz + solDs[2]*dtdz;
5600  const su2double drwdz = solDr[3]*drdz + solDs[3]*dsdz + solDs[3]*dtdz;
5601  const su2double drEdz = solDr[4]*drdz + solDs[4]*dsdz + solDs[4]*dtdz;
5602 
5603  /*--- Compute the divergence of the grid velocity.
5604  SET TO ZERO FOR NOW. THIS IS NOT CORRECT!!!!. ---*/
5605  const su2double divGridVel = 0.0; // Must be multiplied by the Jacobian.
5606 
5607  /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the pressure, scaled with
5608  the Jacobian. */
5609  const su2double dpdx = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdx + kinEnergy*drhodx
5610  - u*drudx - v*drvdx - w*drwdx);
5611  const su2double dpdy = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdy + kinEnergy*drhody
5612  - u*drudy - v*drvdy - w*drwdy);
5613  const su2double dpdz = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdz + kinEnergy*drhodz
5614  - u*drudz - v*drvdz - w*drwdz);
5615 
5616  /* Abbreviations, which make it easier to compute the divergence term. */
5617  const su2double abv1 = drudx + drvdy + drwdz;
5618  const su2double abv2 = u* drhodx + v*drhody + w*drhodz;
5619  const su2double abv3 = u*(drEdx + dpdx) + v*(drEdy + dpdy) + w*(drEdz + dpdz);
5620 
5621  /* Compute the divergence terms for this integration point,
5622  multiplied by the integration weight. */
5623  divFluxInt[0] = weights[i]*(abv1 - rho*divGridVel
5624  - gridVel[0]*drhodx - gridVel[1]*drhody - gridVel[2]*drhodz);
5625  divFluxInt[1] = weights[i]*(dpdx + u*(abv1 - abv2 + drudx) + v*drudy + w*drudz
5626  - ru*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drudx - gridVel[1]*drudy - gridVel[2]*drudz);
5627  divFluxInt[2] = weights[i]*(dpdy + v*(abv1 - abv2 + drvdy) + u*drvdx + w*drvdz
5628  - rv*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drvdx - gridVel[1]*drvdy - gridVel[2]*drvdz);
5629  divFluxInt[3] = weights[i]*(dpdz + w*(abv1 - abv2 + drwdz) + u*drwdx + v*drwdy
5630  - rw*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drwdx - gridVel[1]*drwdy - gridVel[2]*drwdz);
5631  divFluxInt[4] = weights[i]*(abv3 + Htot*(abv1 - abv2) - rE*divGridVel
5632  - gridVel[0]*drEdx - gridVel[1]*drEdy - gridVel[2]*drEdz);
5633 
5634  /* Add the body force to the flux divergence for the momentum and energy
5635  equation. Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
5636  integration weight in order to be consistent with the formulation of
5637  the residual. Also note that for the energy source term the absolute
5638  velocity must be taken and not the relative. */
5639  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5640 
5641  divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*bodyForceX;
5642  divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*bodyForceY;
5643  divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*bodyForceZ;
5644  divFluxInt[4] -= weightJac*(u*bodyForceX + v*bodyForceY + w*bodyForceZ);
5645  }
5646  }
5647 
5648  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5649  /*--- Add the source terms of the manufactured solution to the divergence---*/
5650  /*--- of the fluxes, if a manufactured solution is used. ---*/
5651  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5652 
5653  if( VerificationSolution ) {
5654  if( VerificationSolution->IsManufacturedSolution() ) {
5655 
5656  /*--- Loop over the number of entities that are treated simultaneously. */
5657  for(unsigned short simul=0; simul<nSimul; ++simul) {
5658 
5659  /*--- Loop over the integration points of the element. ---*/
5660  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5661 
5662  /* Set the pointers for this integration point. */
5663  const unsigned short offInt = i*NPad + simul*nVar;
5664  su2double *divFluxInt = divFlux + offInt;
5665 
5666  /* Set the pointer to the coordinates in this integration point.
5667  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5668  THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5669  BE TAKEN. */
5670  const su2double *coor = elem->coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
5671 
5672  /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5673  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5674  THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5675  BE TAKEN. */
5676  const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5677  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5678 
5679  /* Compute the source terms of the manufactured solution.
5680  THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. FOR AN ACTUAL TIME ACCURATE
5681  SIMULATION THE CORRECT TIME MUST BE GIVEN TO THIS FUNCTION. */
5682  su2double sourceMan[5];
5683  VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, 0.0, sourceMan);
5684 
5685  /* Add the source terms to the flux divergence. Note that the source
5686  terms are multiplied with minus the integration weight in order
5687  to be consistent with the formulation of the residual. */
5688  divFluxInt[0] -= weightJac*sourceMan[0];
5689  divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*sourceMan[1];
5690  divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*sourceMan[2];
5691  divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*sourceMan[3];
5692  divFluxInt[4] -= weightJac*sourceMan[4];
5693  }
5694  }
5695  }
5696  }
5697 
5698  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5699  /*--- Compute the residual in the DOFs, which is the matrix product of ---*/
5700  /*--- basisFunctionsIntTrans and divFlux. ---*/
5701  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5702 
5703  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFunctionsIntTrans, divFlux, res, config);
5704 }
5705 
5706 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_TimeInterpolatePredictorSol(CConfig *config,
5707  const unsigned short iTime,
5708  const unsigned long elemBeg,
5709  const unsigned long elemEnd,
5710  const unsigned long nAdjElem,
5711  const unsigned long *adjElem,
5712  const bool secondPartTimeInt,
5713  su2double *solTimeLevel) {
5714 
5715  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5716  /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the solution to the given integration point ---*/
5717  /*--- for the element range elemBeg to elemEnd. These elements ---*/
5718  /*--- belong to the time level considered (not needed to know ---*/
5719  /*--- the actual value in this function) and are therefore ---*/
5720  /*--- continuous in memory. ---*/
5721  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5722 
5723  /* Easier storage of the interpolation coefficients for the current time
5724  integration point (iTime) for the elements of this time interval. */
5725  const unsigned short nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5726  const su2double *DOFToThisTimeInt = timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG
5727  + iTime*nTimeDOFs;
5728 
5729  /* Loop over the element range of this time level. */
5730  for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
5731 
5732  /* Determine the number of solution variables for this element and
5733  set the pointer where the solution variables for this element must be
5734  stored in solTimeLevel. */
5735  const unsigned short nSolVar = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
5736  su2double *solDOFs = solTimeLevel + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
5737 
5738  /* Initialize the solution to zero. */
5739  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i) solDOFs[i] = 0.0;
5740 
5741  /* Loop over the time DOFs, for which the predictor solution is present. */
5742  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5743 
5744  /* Add the contribution of this predictor solution to the interpolated solution. */
5745  const su2double *solPred = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data()
5746  + nVar*(j*nDOFsLocTot + volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal);
5747  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i)
5748  solDOFs[i] += DOFToThisTimeInt[j]*solPred[i];
5749  }
5750  }
5751 
5752  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5753  /*--- Step 2: Interpolate the solution to the given integration point ---*/
5754  /*--- for the elements of the next time level, which are ---*/
5755  /*--- adjacent to elements of the current time level. Note that ---*/
5756  /*--- these elements are not contiguous in memory. ---*/
5757  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5758 
5759  /* For the faces with adjacent elements of a higher time level, the time
5760  integration takes place with twice the number of time integration points
5761  from the perspective of the higher time level. Hence the integration points
5762  iTime must be corrected if the state to be interpolated corresponds to the
5763  second part of the time integration interval. Perform this correction and
5764  determine the corresponding interpolation coefficients. */
5765  unsigned short iiTime = iTime;
5766  if( secondPartTimeInt ) iiTime += config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5767 
5768  DOFToThisTimeInt = timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG + iiTime*nTimeDOFs;
5769 
5770  /* Loop over the adjacent elements. */
5771  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
5772  const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
5773 
5774  /* Determine the number of solution variables for this element and
5775  set the pointer where the solution variables for this element must be
5776  stored in solTimeLevel. */
5777  const unsigned short nSolVar = nVar*volElem[ll].nDOFsSol;
5778  su2double *solDOFs = solTimeLevel + nVar*volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
5779 
5780  /* Initialize the solution to zero. */
5781  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i) solDOFs[i] = 0.0;
5782 
5783  /* Loop over the time DOFs, for which the predictor solution is present. */
5784  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5785 
5786  /* Add the contribution of this predictor solution to the interpolated solution. */
5787  const su2double *solPred = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data()
5788  + nVar*(j*nDOFsLocTot + volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal);
5789  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i)
5790  solDOFs[i] += DOFToThisTimeInt[j]*solPred[i];
5791  }
5792  }
5793 }
5794 
5795 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Shock_Capturing_DG(CConfig *config,
5796  const unsigned long elemBeg,
5797  const unsigned long elemEnd,
5798  su2double *workArray) {
5799 
5800  /*--- Run shock capturing algorithm ---*/
5801  switch( config->GetKind_FEM_DG_Shock() ) {
5802  case FEM_SHOCK_CAPTURING_DG::NONE:
5803  break;
5804  case FEM_SHOCK_CAPTURING_DG::PERSSON:
5805  // to be done
5806  //Shock_Capturing_DG_Persson(elemBeg, elemEnd, workArray);
5807  break;
5808  }
5809 }
5810 
5811 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Volume_Residual(CConfig *config,
5812  const unsigned long elemBeg,
5813  const unsigned long elemEnd,
5814  su2double *workArray) {
5815 
5816  /*--- Determine whether a body force term is present. ---*/
5817  bool body_force = config->GetBody_Force();
5818  const su2double *body_force_vector = body_force ? config->GetBody_Force_Vector() : nullptr;
5819 
5820  /*--- Get the physical time for MMS if necessary. ---*/
5821  su2double time = 0.0;
5822  if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
5823 
5824  /* Determine the number of elements that are treated simultaneously
5825  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
5826  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
5827  const unsigned short nElemSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
5828 
5829  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
5830  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
5831  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
5832 
5833  /* Store the number of metric points per integration point, which depends
5834  on the number of dimensions. */
5835  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5836 
5837  /*--- Loop over the given element range to compute the contribution of the
5838  volume integral in the DG FEM formulation to the residual. Multiple
5839  elements are treated simultaneously to improve the performance
5840  of the matrix multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the
5841  counter l happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
5842  for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd;) {
5843 
5844  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of elements and the padded
5845  N value in the gemm computations. */
5846  unsigned long lEnd;
5847  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
5848 
5849  MetaDataChunkOfElem(volElem, l, elemEnd, nElemSimul, nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
5850 
5851  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
5852  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5853  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
5854  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5855  const su2double *matBasisIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegrationTrans();
5856  const su2double *matDerBasisIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetDerMatBasisFunctionsIntTrans();
5857  const su2double *weights = standardElementsSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
5858 
5859  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
5860  su2double *solDOFs = workArray;
5861  su2double *sources = solDOFs + nDOFs*NPad;
5862  su2double *solInt = sources + nInt *NPad;
5863  su2double *fluxes = solInt + nInt *NPad;
5864 
5865  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5866  /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the solution to the integration points of ---*/
5867  /*--- the element. ---*/
5868  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5869 
5870  /* Copy the solution of the DOFs into solDOFs for this chunk of elements. */
5871  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
5872 
5873  /* Easier storage of the solution variables for this element. */
5874  const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
5875  const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[lInd].timeLevel;
5876  const su2double *solDOFsElem = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevel].data()
5877  + nVar*volElem[lInd].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
5878 
5879  /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
5880  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
5881  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
5882  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
5883  solDOFs[i*NPad+llNVar+mm] = solDOFsElem[i*nVar+mm];
5884  }
5885 
5886  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product to determine
5887  the solution in the integration points of the chunk of elements. */
5888  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, matBasisInt, solDOFs, solInt, config);
5889 
5890  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5891  /*--- Step 2: Compute the inviscid fluxes, multiplied by minus the ---*/
5892  /*--- integration weight, in the integration points. ---*/
5893  /*--- If needed, also the source terms are computed. ---*/
5894  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5895 
5896  /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
5897  in order to have the most efficient code. */
5898  switch( nDim ) {
5899 
5900  case 2: {
5901 
5902  /* 2D simulation. Loop over the chunk of elements and loop over the
5903  integration points of the elements to compute the fluxes. */
5904  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
5905  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
5906  const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
5907 
5908  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5909  const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
5910 
5911  /* Easier storage of the metric terms and grid velocities
5912  in this integration point. */
5913  const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
5914  + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5915  const su2double Jac = metricTerms[0];
5916  const su2double *gridVel = volElem[lInd].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
5917 
5918  /* Compute the metric terms multiplied by minus the integration weight.
5919  The minus sign comes from the integration by parts in the weak
5920  formulation. */
5921  const su2double wDrdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[1];
5922  const su2double wDrdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[2];
5923 
5924  const su2double wDsdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[3];
5925  const su2double wDsdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[4];
5926 
5927  /* Easier storage of the location where the solution data of this
5928  integration point starts. */
5929  const su2double *sol = solInt + iNPad + llNVar;
5930 
5931  /*--- Compute the velocities and static energy in this integration point. ---*/
5932  const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/sol[0];
5933  const su2double u = sol[1]*rhoInv;
5934  const su2double v = sol[2]*rhoInv;
5935  const su2double TotalEnergy = sol[3]*rhoInv;
5936  const su2double StaticEnergy = TotalEnergy - 0.5*(u*u + v*v);
5937 
5938  /*--- Compute the pressure. ---*/
5939  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
5940  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
5941 
5942  /* Compute the relative velocities w.r.t. the grid. */
5943  const su2double uRel = u - gridVel[0];
5944  const su2double vRel = v - gridVel[1];
5945 
5946  /* Set the pointer for the fluxes in this integration point. */
5947  su2double *flux = fluxes + nDim*iNPad + llNVar;
5948 
5949  /*--- Fluxes in r-direction. */
5950  const su2double Ur = uRel*wDrdx + vRel*wDrdy;
5951 
5952  flux[0] = sol[0]*Ur;
5953  flux[1] = sol[1]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdx;
5954  flux[2] = sol[2]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdy;
5955  flux[3] = sol[3]*Ur + Pressure*(u*wDrdx + v*wDrdy);
5956 
5957  /*--- Fluxes in s-direction. */
5958  flux = flux + NPad;
5959  const su2double Us = uRel*wDsdx + vRel*wDsdy;
5960 
5961  flux[0] = sol[0]*Us;
5962  flux[1] = sol[1]*Us + Pressure*wDsdx;
5963  flux[2] = sol[2]*Us + Pressure*wDsdy;
5964  flux[3] = sol[3]*Us + Pressure*(u*wDsdx + v*wDsdy);
5965 
5966  /*--- If needed, compute the body forces in this integration point.
5967  Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
5968  integration weight in order to be consistent with the
5969  formulation of the residual. Note that for the energy source
5970  term the absolute velocity must be taken and not the
5971  relative. ---*/
5972  if( body_force ) {
5973  su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
5974  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*Jac;
5975 
5976  source[0] = 0.0;
5977  source[1] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[0];
5978  source[2] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[1];
5979  source[3] = -weightJac*(u*body_force_vector[0] + v*body_force_vector[1]);
5980  }
5981  }
5982  }
5983 
5984  break;
5985  }
5986 
5987  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5988 
5989  case 3: {
5990 
5991  /* 3D simulation. Loop over the chunk of elements and loop over the
5992  integration points of the elements to compute the fluxes. */
5993  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
5994  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
5995  const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
5996  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5997  const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
5998 
5999  /* Easier storage of the metric terms and grid velocities
6000  in this integration point. */
6001  const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
6002  + i*nMetricPerPoint;
6003  const su2double Jac = metricTerms[0];
6004  const su2double *gridVel = volElem[lInd].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6005 
6006  /* Compute the metric terms multiplied by minus the integration weight.
6007  The minus sign comes from the integration by parts in the weak
6008  formulation. */
6009  const su2double wDrdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[1];
6010  const su2double wDrdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[2];
6011  const su2double wDrdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[3];
6012 
6013  const su2double wDsdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[4];
6014  const su2double wDsdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[5];
6015  const su2double wDsdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[6];
6016 
6017  const su2double wDtdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[7];
6018  const su2double wDtdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[8];
6019  const su2double wDtdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[9];
6020 
6021  /* Easier storage of the location where the solution data of this
6022  integration point starts. */
6023  const su2double *sol = solInt + iNPad + llNVar;
6024 
6025  /*--- Compute the velocities and static energy in this integration point. ---*/
6026  const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/sol[0];
6027  const su2double u = sol[1]*rhoInv;
6028  const su2double v = sol[2]*rhoInv;
6029  const su2double w = sol[3]*rhoInv;
6030  const su2double TotalEnergy = sol[4]*rhoInv;
6031  const su2double StaticEnergy = TotalEnergy - 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
6032 
6033  /*--- Compute the pressure. ---*/
6034  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
6035  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
6036 
6037  /* Compute the relative velocities w.r.t. the grid. */
6038  const su2double uRel = u - gridVel[0];
6039  const su2double vRel = v - gridVel[1];
6040  const su2double wRel = w - gridVel[2];
6041 
6042  /* Set the pointer for the fluxes in this integration point. */
6043  su2double *flux = fluxes + nDim*iNPad + llNVar;
6044 
6045  /*--- Fluxes in r-direction. */
6046  const su2double Ur = uRel*wDrdx + vRel*wDrdy + wRel*wDrdz;
6047 
6048  flux[0] = sol[0]*Ur;
6049  flux[1] = sol[1]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdx;
6050  flux[2] = sol[2]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdy;
6051  flux[3] = sol[3]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdz;
6052  flux[4] = sol[4]*Ur + Pressure*(u*wDrdx + v*wDrdy + w*wDrdz);
6053 
6054  /*--- Fluxes in s-direction. */
6055  flux = flux + NPad;
6056  const su2double Us = uRel*wDsdx + vRel*wDsdy + wRel*wDsdz;
6057 
6058  flux[0] = sol[0]*Us;
6059  flux[1] = sol[1]*Us + Pressure*wDsdx;
6060  flux[2] = sol[2]*Us + Pressure*wDsdy;
6061  flux[3] = sol[3]*Us + Pressure*wDsdz;
6062  flux[4] = sol[4]*Us + Pressure*(u*wDsdx + v*wDsdy + w*wDsdz);
6063 
6064  /*--- Fluxes in t-direction. */
6065  flux = flux + NPad;
6066  const su2double Ut = uRel*wDtdx + vRel*wDtdy + wRel*wDtdz;
6067 
6068  flux[0] = sol[0]*Ut;
6069  flux[1] = sol[1]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdx;
6070  flux[2] = sol[2]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdy;
6071  flux[3] = sol[3]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdz;
6072  flux[4] = sol[4]*Ut + Pressure*(u*wDtdx + v*wDtdy + w*wDtdz);
6073 
6074  /*--- If needed, compute the body forces in this integration point.
6075  Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
6076  integration weight in order to be consistent with the
6077  formulation of the residual. Note that for the energy source
6078  term the absolute velocity must be taken and not the
6079  relative. ---*/
6080  if( body_force ) {
6081  su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
6082  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*Jac;
6083 
6084  source[0] = 0.0;
6085  source[1] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[0];
6086  source[2] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[1];
6087  source[3] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[2];
6088  source[4] = -weightJac*(u*body_force_vector[0] + v*body_force_vector[1]
6089  + w*body_force_vector[2]);
6090  }
6091  }
6092  }
6093 
6094  break;
6095  }
6096  }
6097 
6098  /* Initialize addSourceTerms to body_force. The value of addSourceTerms
6099  is set to true when a manufactured solution is computed. */
6100  bool addSourceTerms = body_force;
6101 
6102  /* Check whether or not a manufactured solution is used. */
6103  if( VerificationSolution ) {
6104  if( VerificationSolution->IsManufacturedSolution() ) {
6105 
6106  /*--- For the manufactured solutions a source term must be added. If a
6107  standard source term has not been specified, initialize the source
6108  terms to zero and set addSourceTerms to true. ---*/
6109  addSourceTerms = true;
6110  if( !body_force ) {
6111  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nInt*NPad); ++i)
6112  sources[i] = 0.0;
6113  }
6114 
6115  /*--- Loop over the chunk of elements and its integration points. ---*/
6116  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6117  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6118  const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
6119  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6120  const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
6121 
6122  /* Determine the integration weight multiplied by the Jacobian. */
6123  const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
6124  + i*nMetricPerPoint;
6125  const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
6126 
6127  /* Set the pointer to the coordinates in this integration point and
6128  call the function to compute the source terms for the manufactured
6129  solution. */
6130  const su2double *coor = volElem[lInd].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6131 
6132  su2double sourceMan[5];
6133 
6134  VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, time, sourceMan);
6135 
6136  /*--- Subtract the source term of the manufactured solution, multiplied
6137  by the appropriate weight, from the possibly earlier computed
6138  source term. It is subtracted in order to be consistent with
6139  the definition of the residual used in this code. ---*/
6140  su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
6141  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6142  source[k] -= weightJac*sourceMan[k];
6143  }
6144  }
6145  }
6146  }
6147 
6148  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6149  /*--- Step 3: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
6150  /*--- integration over the volume element. ---*/
6151  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6152 
6153  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product.
6154  Use solDOFs as a temporary storage for the matrix product. */
6155  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt*nDim, matDerBasisIntTrans, fluxes, solDOFs, config);
6156 
6157  /* Add the contribution from the source terms, if needed. Use solInt
6158  as temporary storage for the matrix product. */
6159  if( addSourceTerms ) {
6160 
6161  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
6162  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, matBasisIntTrans, sources, solInt, config);
6163 
6164  /* Add the residuals due to source terms to the volume residuals */
6165  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nDOFs*NPad); ++i)
6166  solDOFs[i] += solInt[i];
6167  }
6168 
6169  /* Loop over the elements in this chunk to store the residuals
6170  in the appropriate locations. */
6171  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6172  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6173  const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
6174 
6175  /* Easier storage of the residuals for this volume element. */
6176  su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*volElem[lInd].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6177 
6178  /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
6179  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
6180  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6181  res[i*nVar+mm] = solDOFs[i*NPad+llNVar+mm];
6182  }
6183 
6184  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
6185  current chunk. */
6186  l = lEnd;
6187  }
6188 }
6189 
6190 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Boundary_Conditions(const unsigned short timeLevel,
6191  CConfig *config,
6192  CNumerics **numerics,
6193  const bool haloInfoNeededForBC,
6194  su2double *workArray){
6195 
6196  /* Loop over all boundaries. */
6197  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
6198 
6199  /* Check if this boundary marker must be treated at all. */
6200  if(boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC == haloInfoNeededForBC) {
6201 
6202  /* Determine the range of faces for this time level and test if any
6203  surface element for this marker must be treated at all. */
6204  const unsigned long surfElemBeg = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel];
6205  const unsigned long surfElemEnd = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel+1];
6206 
6207  if(surfElemEnd > surfElemBeg) {
6208 
6209  /* Set the starting position in the vector for the face residuals for
6210  this boundary marker and time level and set the pointer to the boundary
6211  faces for this boundary marker. */
6212  su2double *resFaces = VecResFaces.data()
6213  + nVar*startLocResFacesMarkers[iMarker][timeLevel];
6214 
6215  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
6216 
6217  /* Apply the appropriate boundary condition. */
6218  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6219  case EULER_WALL:
6220  BC_Euler_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6221  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6222  break;
6223  case FAR_FIELD:
6224  BC_Far_Field(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6225  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6226  break;
6227  case SYMMETRY_PLANE:
6228  BC_Sym_Plane(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6229  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6230  break;
6231  case SUPERSONIC_INLET: /* Use far field for this. When a more detailed state
6232  needs to be specified, use a Riemann boundary. */
6233  BC_Far_Field(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6234  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6235  break;
6236  case SUPERSONIC_OUTLET:
6237  BC_Supersonic_Outlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6238  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6239  break;
6240  case INLET_FLOW:
6241  BC_Inlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6242  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6243  break;
6244  case OUTLET_FLOW:
6245  BC_Outlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6246  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6247  break;
6248  case ISOTHERMAL:
6249  BC_Isothermal_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6250  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6251  break;
6252  case HEAT_FLUX:
6253  BC_HeatFlux_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6254  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6255  break;
6256  case RIEMANN_BOUNDARY:
6257  BC_Riemann(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6258  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6259  break;
6260  case CUSTOM_BOUNDARY:
6261  BC_Custom(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6262  numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6263  break;
6264  case PERIODIC_BOUNDARY: // Nothing to be done for a periodic boundary.
6265  break;
6266  default:
6267  SU2_MPI::Error("BC not implemented.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6268  }
6269  }
6270  }
6271  }
6272 }
6273 
6274 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ResidualFaces(CConfig *config,
6275  const unsigned long indFaceBeg,
6276  const unsigned long indFaceEnd,
6277  unsigned long &indResFaces,
6278  CNumerics *numerics,
6279  su2double *workArray) {
6280 
6281  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
6282  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
6283  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
6284  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
6285 
6286  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
6287  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
6288  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
6289 
6290  /*--- Loop over the requested range of matching faces. Multiple faces
6291  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
6292  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
6293  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
6294  for(unsigned long l=indFaceBeg; l<indFaceEnd;) {
6295 
6296  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
6297  N value in the gemm computations. */
6298  unsigned long lEnd;
6299  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
6300 
6301  MetaDataChunkOfElem(matchingInternalFaces, l, indFaceEnd, nFaceSimul,
6302  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
6303 
6304  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
6305  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6306  const su2double *weights = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
6307 
6308  const unsigned short nDOFsFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
6309  const unsigned short nDOFsFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide1();
6310 
6311  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
6312  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
6313  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*max(nInt, nDOFsFace0);
6314  su2double *fluxes = solIntR + NPad*max(nInt, nDOFsFace1);
6315 
6316  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6317  /*--- Step 1: Compute the inviscid fluxes in the integration points of ---*/
6318  /*--- this matching face multiplied by the integration weight. ---*/
6319  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6320 
6321  /* Compute the inviscid fluxes in the integration points. */
6322  InviscidFluxesInternalMatchingFace(config, l, lEnd, NPad,
6323  solIntL, solIntR, fluxes, numerics);
6324 
6325  /* Multiply the fluxes with the integration weight of the corresponding
6326  integration point. */
6327  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6328  su2double *flux = fluxes + i*NPad;
6329 
6330  for(unsigned short j=0; j<NPad; ++j)
6331  flux[j] *= weights[i];
6332  }
6333 
6334  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6335  /*--- Step 2: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
6336  /*--- integration over this chunk of internal matching faces. ---*/
6337  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6338 
6339  /* Get the correct form of the basis functions needed for the matrix
6340  multiplication to compute the residual. Use solIntL as a temporary
6341  buffer to store this product. */
6342  const su2double *basisFaceTrans = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTransposeSide0();
6343  su2double *resSide0 = solIntL;
6344 
6345  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
6346  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFsFace0, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, resSide0, config);
6347 
6348  /* Check if the number of DOFs on both sides of the face is different.
6349  In that case also the matrix product with the basis functions on side 1
6350  must be carried out. Use solIntR as a temporary buffer to store
6351  this product. */
6352  su2double *resSide1 = solIntR;
6353  if(nDOFsFace1 != nDOFsFace0) {
6354  basisFaceTrans = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTransposeSide1();
6355  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFsFace1, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, resSide1, config);
6356  }
6357 
6358  /* Loop over the number of faces in this chunk. */
6359  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6360 
6361  /* Set the pointer in the residual array where the residual of side 0
6362  and side 1 of this face must be stored. Update the counter. */
6363  su2double *resFace0 = VecResFaces.data() + indResFaces*nVar;
6364  indResFaces += nDOFsFace0;
6365  su2double *resFace1 = VecResFaces.data() + indResFaces*nVar;
6366  indResFaces += nDOFsFace1;
6367 
6368  /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data for side 0. */
6369  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace0; ++i)
6370  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6371  resFace0[nVar*i+mm] = resSide0[NPad*i+nVar*ll+mm];
6372 
6373  /* If the number of DOFs on both sides is the same, then the residual
6374  of side 1 is obtained by simply negating the residual of side 0.
6375  Otherwise a copy must be carried out and the residual negated,
6376  because the normal is pointing into the adjacent element for side 1. */
6377  if(nDOFsFace1 == nDOFsFace0) {
6378  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*nDOFsFace1); ++i)
6379  resFace1[i] = -resFace0[i];
6380  }
6381  else {
6382  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace1; ++i)
6383  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6384  resFace1[nVar*i+mm] = -resSide1[NPad*i+nVar*ll+mm];
6385  }
6386  }
6387 
6388  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
6389  current chunk. */
6390  l = lEnd;
6391  }
6392 }
6393 
6394 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::InviscidFluxesInternalMatchingFace(
6395  CConfig *config,
6396  const unsigned long lBeg,
6397  const unsigned long lEnd,
6398  const unsigned short NPad,
6399  su2double *solIntL,
6400  su2double *solIntR,
6401  su2double *fluxes,
6402  CNumerics *numerics) {
6403 
6404  /* Set the pointer solFace to fluxes. This is just for readability, as the
6405  same memory can be used for the storage of the solution of the DOFs of
6406  the face and the fluxes. */
6407  su2double *solFace = fluxes;
6408 
6409  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6410  /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the left state in the integration points of ---*/
6411  /*--- the face. ---*/
6412  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6413 
6414  /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face,
6415  which is the same for the chunk of faces considered. */
6416  const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[lBeg].indStandardElement;
6417  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6418  const unsigned short nDOFsFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
6419  const su2double *basisFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
6420 
6421  /* Determine the number of faces treated simultaneously and define the arrays
6422  of pointers to be used later on in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
6423  const unsigned short llEnd = lEnd - lBeg;
6424  const su2double* arrNorm[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
6425  const su2double* arrGridVel[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
6426 
6427  if(llEnd > SIZE_ARR_NORM)
6428  SU2_MPI::Error("SIZE_ARR_NORM is too small. Increase it or decrease ALIGNED_BYTES_MATMUL",
6429  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6430 
6431  /*--- Loop over the chunk of faces to copy the states in the DOFs
6432  of the faces in the correct sequence. ---*/
6433  for(unsigned long l=lBeg; l<lEnd; ++l) {
6434  const unsigned short ll = l-lBeg;
6435  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6436 
6437  /* Store the pointer to the normal and grid velocity information of this
6438  face. This is used later on in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
6439  arrNorm[ll] = matchingInternalFaces[l].metricNormalsFace.data();
6440  arrGridVel[ll] = matchingInternalFaces[l].gridVelocities.data();
6441 
6442  /* Determine the time level of the face. */
6443  const unsigned long elem0 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID0;
6444  const unsigned long elem1 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID1;
6445  const unsigned short timeLevelFace = min(volElem[elem0].timeLevel,
6446  volElem[elem1].timeLevel);
6447 
6448  /* The numbering of the DOFs is given for the entire grid. However, in the
6449  working vectors for the solution a numbering per time level is used.
6450  Therefore an offset must be applied, which can be obtained from the
6451  corresponding volume element. Note that this offset is non-negative
6452  and depends whether or not the element belongs to the same time
6453  level as the face. */
6454  unsigned long offset;
6455  if(timeLevelFace == volElem[elem0].timeLevel)
6456  offset = volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
6457  else
6458  offset = volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
6459 
6460  /*--- Store the solution of the DOFs of side 0 of the face in contiguous
6461  memory, such that the function blasFunctions->gemm can be used to
6462  compute the left states in the integration points. ---*/
6463  const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingInternalFaces[l].DOFsSolFaceSide0.data();
6464  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace0; ++i) {
6465  const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevelFace].data()
6466  + nVar*(DOFs[i] - offset);
6467  su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
6468  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6469  sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6470  }
6471  }
6472 
6473  /* Compute the left states. Call the general function to
6474  carry out the matrix product. */
6475  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFsFace0, basisFace0, solFace, solIntL, config);
6476 
6477  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6478  /*--- Step 2: Interpolate the right state in the integration points of ---*/
6479  /*--- the face. ---*/
6480  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6481 
6482  /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face,
6483  which is the same for the chunk of faces considered. */
6484  const unsigned short nDOFsFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide1();
6485  const su2double *basisFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide1();
6486 
6487  /*--- Loop over the chunk of elements to copy the states in the DOFs
6488  of the faces in the correct sequence. ---*/
6489  for(unsigned long l=lBeg; l<lEnd; ++l) {
6490  const unsigned short ll = l-lBeg;
6491  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6492 
6493  /* Determine the time level of the face. */
6494  const unsigned long elem0 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID0;
6495  const unsigned long elem1 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID1;
6496  const unsigned short timeLevelFace = min(volElem[elem0].timeLevel,
6497  volElem[elem1].timeLevel);
6498 
6499  /* Determine the offset between the numbering used in the DOFs of the face
6500  and the numbering used in the working solution vectors, see above for a
6501  more detailed explanation. */
6502  unsigned long offset;
6503  if(timeLevelFace == volElem[elem1].timeLevel)
6504  offset = volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
6505  else
6506  offset = volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
6507 
6508  /*--- Store the solution of the DOFs of side 1 of the face in contiguous
6509  memory, such that the function blasFunctions->gemm can be used to
6510  compute the left states in the integration points. ---*/
6511  const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingInternalFaces[l].DOFsSolFaceSide1.data();
6512  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace1; ++i) {
6513  const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevelFace].data()
6514  + nVar*(DOFs[i] - offset);
6515  su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
6516  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6517  sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6518  }
6519  }
6520 
6521  /* Compute the right states. Call the general function to
6522  carry out the matrix product. */
6523  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFsFace1, basisFace1, solFace, solIntR, config);
6524 
6525  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6526  /*--- Step 3: Compute the fluxes in the integration points using the ---*/
6527  /*--- approximate Riemann solver. ---*/
6528  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6529 
6530  /* General function to compute the fluxes in the integration points
6531  of the faces. */
6532  ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(config, llEnd, NPad, nInt, arrNorm, arrGridVel,
6533  solIntL, solIntR, fluxes, numerics);
6534 }
6535 
6536 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::AccumulateSpaceTimeResidualADEROwnedElem(
6537  CConfig *config,
6538  const unsigned short timeLevel,
6539  const unsigned short intPoint) {
6540 
6541  /* Compute half the integration weight. The reason for doing this is that the
6542  given integration weight is based on the normalized interval [-1..1], i.e.
6543  a length of two. Also compute a quarter of the weight, which is necessary
6544  to accumulate the face residuals of the DOFs of elements adjacent to
6545  element of a lower time level. */
6546  const su2double *timeIntegrationWeights = config->GetWeightsIntegrationADER_DG();
6547 
6548  const su2double halfWeight = 0.5 *timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6549  const su2double quartWeight = 0.25*timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6550 
6551  /* Determine the owned element range that must be considered. */
6552  const unsigned long elemBegOwned = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel];
6553  const unsigned long elemEndOwned = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6554 
6555  /* Add the residuals coming from the volume integral to VecTotResDOFsADER. */
6556  for(unsigned long l=elemBegOwned; l<elemEndOwned; ++l) {
6557  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6558  const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
6559  su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + offset;
6560 
6561  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i)
6562  resADER[i] += halfWeight*res[i];
6563  }
6564 
6565  /* Add the residuals coming from the surface integral to VecTotResDOFsADER.
6566  This part is from faces with the same time level as the element. */
6567  for(unsigned long l=elemBegOwned; l<elemEndOwned; ++l) {
6568  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6569  const unsigned long ii = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6570  su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6571 
6572  for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6573  const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6574  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6575  resADER[k] += halfWeight*resFace[k];
6576  }
6577  }
6578  }
6579 
6580  /* Check if this is not the last time level. */
6581  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
6582  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
6583 
6584  /* There may exist faces of this time level, which have a neighboring
6585  element of the next time level. The residuals of the DOFs of such
6586  elements must be updated with the face residuals of the current
6587  time level. However, on these elements the time step is twice as
6588  large. This is taken into account by multiplying the face residual
6589  with quartWeight when accumulating. */
6590  const unsigned long nAdjElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].size();
6591  const unsigned long *adjElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].data();
6592 
6593  for(unsigned l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
6594  const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
6595  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ll].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6596  const unsigned long ii = volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6597  su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6598 
6599  for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6600  const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResAdjFaces[j];
6601  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6602  resADER[k] += quartWeight*resFace[k];
6603  }
6604  }
6605  }
6606  }
6607 }
6608 
6609 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::AccumulateSpaceTimeResidualADERHaloElem(
6610  CConfig *config,
6611  const unsigned short timeLevel,
6612  const unsigned short intPoint) {
6613 
6614  /* Compute half the integration weight. The reason for doing this is that the
6615  given integration weight is based on the normalized interval [-1..1], i.e.
6616  a length of two. Also compute a quarter of the weight, which is necessary
6617  to accumulate the face residuals of the DOFs of elements adjacent to
6618  element of a lower time level. */
6619  const su2double *timeIntegrationWeights = config->GetWeightsIntegrationADER_DG();
6620 
6621  const su2double halfWeight = 0.5 *timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6622  const su2double quartWeight = 0.25*timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6623 
6624  /* Determine the halo element range that must be considered. */
6625  const unsigned long elemBegHalo = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel];
6626  const unsigned long elemEndHalo = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6627 
6628  /* Add the residuals coming from the surface integral to VecTotResDOFsADER.
6629  This part is from faces with the same time level as the element. */
6630  for(unsigned long l=elemBegHalo; l<elemEndHalo; ++l) {
6631  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6632  const unsigned long ii = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6633  su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6634 
6635  for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6636  const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6637  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6638  resADER[k] += halfWeight*resFace[k];
6639  }
6640  }
6641  }
6642 
6643  /* Check if this is not the last time level. */
6644  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
6645  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
6646 
6647  /* There may exist faces of this time level, which have a neighboring
6648  element of the next time level. The residuals of the DOFs of such
6649  elements must be updated with the face residuals of the current
6650  time level. However, on these elements the time step is twice as
6651  large. This is taken into account by multiplying the face residual
6652  with quartWeight when accumulating. */
6653  const unsigned long nAdjElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].size();
6654  const unsigned long *adjElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].data();
6655 
6656  for(unsigned l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
6657  const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
6658  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ll].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6659  const unsigned long ii = volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6660  su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6661 
6662  for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6663  const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResAdjFaces[j];
6664  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6665  resADER[k] += quartWeight*resFace[k];
6666  }
6667  }
6668  }
6669  }
6670 }
6671 
6672 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::CreateFinalResidual(const unsigned short timeLevel,
6673  const bool ownedElements) {
6674 
6675  /* Determine the element range for which the final residual must
6676  be created. */
6677  unsigned long elemStart, elemEnd;
6678  if( ownedElements ) {
6679  elemStart = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0];
6680  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6681  }
6682  else {
6683  elemStart = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[0];
6684  elemEnd = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6685  }
6686 
6687  /* For the halo elements the residual is initialized to zero. */
6688  if( !ownedElements ) {
6689 
6690  for(unsigned long l=elemStart; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6691  su2double *resDOFsElem = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6692  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i)
6693  resDOFsElem[i] = 0.0;
6694  }
6695  }
6696 
6697  /* Loop over the required element range. */
6698  for(unsigned long l=elemStart; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6699 
6700  /* Loop over the DOFs of this element. */
6701  for(unsigned long i=volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6702  i<(volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal+volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i) {
6703 
6704  /* Create the final residual by summing up all contributions. */
6705  su2double *resDOF = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
6706  for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[i]; j<nEntriesResFaces[i+1]; ++j) {
6707  const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6708  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6709  resDOF[k] += resFace[k];
6710  }
6711  }
6712  }
6713 }
6714 
6715 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::MultiplyResidualByInverseMassMatrix(
6716  CConfig *config,
6717  const bool useADER,
6718  const unsigned long elemBeg,
6719  const unsigned long elemEnd,
6720  su2double *workArray) {
6721 
6722  /*--- Set the reference to the correct residual. This depends
6723  whether or not the ADER scheme is used. ---*/
6724  vector<su2double> &VecRes = useADER ? VecTotResDOFsADER : VecResDOFs;
6725 
6726  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6727  for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6728 
6729  /* Easier storage of the residuals for this volume element. */
6730  su2double *res = VecRes.data() + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6731 
6732  /* Check whether a multiplication must be carried out with the inverse of
6733  the lumped mass matrix or the full mass matrix. Note that it is crucial
6734  that the test is performed with the lumpedMassMatrix and not with
6735  massMatrix. The reason is that for implicit time stepping schemes
6736  both arrays may be in use. */
6737  if( volElem[l].lumpedMassMatrix.size() ) {
6738 
6739  /* Multiply the residual with the inverse of the lumped mass matrix. */
6740  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6741 
6742  su2double *resDOF = res + nVar*i;
6743  su2double lMInv = 1.0/volElem[l].lumpedMassMatrix[i];
6744  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k) resDOF[k] *= lMInv;
6745  }
6746  }
6747  else {
6748 
6749  /* Multiply the residual with the inverse of the mass matrix.
6750  Use the array workArray as temporary storage. */
6751  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++mm)
6752  workArray[mm] = res[mm];
6753 
6754  blasFunctions->gemm(volElem[l].nDOFsSol, nVar, volElem[l].nDOFsSol,
6755  volElem[l].invMassMatrix.data(), workArray, res, config);
6756  }
6757  }
6758 }
6759 
6760 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Pressure_Forces(const CGeometry* geometry, const CConfig* config) {
6761 
6762  /* Allocate the memory for the work array and initialize it to zero to avoid
6763  warnings in debug mode about uninitialized memory when padding is applied. */
6764  vector<su2double> workArrayVec(sizeWorkArray, 0.0);
6765  su2double *workArray = workArrayVec.data();
6766 
6767  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
6768  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
6769  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
6770  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
6771 
6772  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
6773  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
6774  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
6775 
6776  /*--- Get the information of the angle of attack, reference area, etc. ---*/
6777  const su2double Alpha = config->GetAoA()*PI_NUMBER/180.0;
6778  const su2double Beta = config->GetAoS()*PI_NUMBER/180.0;
6779  const su2double RefArea = config->GetRefArea();
6780  const su2double RefLength = config->GetRefLength();
6781  const su2double Gas_Constant = config->GetGas_ConstantND();
6782  auto Origin = config->GetRefOriginMoment(0);
6783  const bool grid_movement = config->GetGrid_Movement();
6784 
6785  /*--- Evaluate reference values for non-dimensionalization.
6786  For dynamic meshes, use the motion Mach number as a reference value
6787  for computing the force coefficients. Otherwise, use the freestream
6788  values, which is the standard convention. ---*/
6789  const su2double RefTemp = Temperature_Inf;
6790  const su2double RefDensity = Density_Inf;
6791 
6792  su2double RefVel2;
6793  if (grid_movement) {
6794  const su2double Mach2Vel = sqrt(Gamma*Gas_Constant*RefTemp);
6795  const su2double Mach_Motion = config->GetMach_Motion();
6796  RefVel2 = (Mach_Motion*Mach2Vel)*(Mach_Motion*Mach2Vel);
6797  }
6798  else {
6799  RefVel2 = 0.0;
6800  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6801  RefVel2 += Velocity_Inf[iDim]*Velocity_Inf[iDim];
6802  }
6803 
6804  AeroCoeffForceRef = 0.5 * RefDensity * RefArea * RefVel2;
6805  const su2double factor = 1.0 / AeroCoeffForceRef;
6806 
6807  /*-- Variables initialization ---*/
6808  Total_CD = 0.0; Total_CL = 0.0; Total_CSF = 0.0; Total_CEff = 0.0;
6809  Total_CMx = 0.0; Total_CMy = 0.0; Total_CMz = 0.0;
6810  Total_CFx = 0.0; Total_CFy = 0.0; Total_CFz = 0.0;
6811 
6812  AllBound_CD_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CL_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CSF_Inv = 0.0;
6813  AllBound_CMx_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CMy_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CMz_Inv = 0.0;
6814  AllBound_CFx_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CFy_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CFz_Inv = 0.0;
6815  AllBound_CEff_Inv = 0.0;
6816 
6817  for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
6818  Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6819  Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CEff_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6820  Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6821  Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6822  Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6823  Surface_CL[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CD[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6824  Surface_CSF[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CEff[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6825  Surface_CFx[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CFy[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6826  Surface_CFz[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMx[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6827  Surface_CMy[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMz[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6828  }
6829 
6830  /*--- Loop over the Euler and Navier-Stokes markers ---*/
6831  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6832 
6833  /* Check if this boundary must be monitored. */
6834  const unsigned short Monitoring = config->GetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker);
6835  if(Monitoring == YES) {
6836 
6837  /* Easier storage of the boundary condition. */
6838  const unsigned short Boundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker);
6839 
6840  /*--- Obtain the origin for the moment computation for a particular marker ---*/
6841  for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
6842  ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
6843  string Monitoring_Tag = config->GetMarker_Monitoring_TagBound(iMarker_Monitoring);
6844  string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6845  if (Marker_Tag == Monitoring_Tag)
6846  Origin = config->GetRefOriginMoment(iMarker_Monitoring);
6847  }
6848 
6849  /* Check for a boundary for which the forces must be computed. */
6850  if((Boundary == EULER_WALL) || (Boundary == HEAT_FLUX) ||
6851  (Boundary == ISOTHERMAL)) {
6852 
6853  /*--- Initialization for this marker ---*/
6854  CD_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CL_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CSF_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6855  CMx_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CMy_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CMz_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6856  CFx_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CFy_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CFz_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6857  CEff_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6858 
6859  su2double ForceInviscid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6860  su2double MomentInviscid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6861 
6862  /* Easier storage of the boundary faces for this boundary marker. */
6863  const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
6864  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
6865 
6866  /*--- Loop over the faces of this boundary. Multiple faces are treated
6867  simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
6868  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
6869  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
6870  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem;) {
6871 
6872  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
6873  N value in the gemm computations. */
6874  unsigned long lEnd;
6875  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
6876 
6877  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, nSurfElem, nFaceSimul,
6878  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
6879 
6880  /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face. */
6881  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6882  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
6883  const su2double *basisFace = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
6884  const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
6885 
6886  /* Set the pointers for the local work arrays. */
6887  su2double *solInt = workArray;
6888  su2double *workArray = solInt + NPad*nInt;
6889 
6890  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
6891  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6892  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6893 
6894  /* Easier storage of the DOFs of the face. */
6895  const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l+ll].DOFsSolFace.data();
6896 
6897  /* Copy the solution of the DOFs of the face such that it is
6898  contiguous in memory. */
6899  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6900  const su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*DOFs[i];
6901  su2double *sol = workArray + NPad*i + llNVar;
6902  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6903  sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6904  }
6905  }
6906 
6907  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product to determine
6908  the solution in the integration points. */
6909  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, basisFace, workArray, solInt, config);
6910 
6911  /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
6912  in order to have the most efficient code. */
6913  switch( nDim ) {
6914 
6915  case 2: {
6916 
6917  /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
6918  simultaneously. */
6919  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6920  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6921  const unsigned long lll = l + ll;
6922 
6923  /* Loop over the integration points of this surface element. */
6924  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6925 
6926  /* Easier storage of the solution, the normals and the coordinates
6927  for this integration point. */
6928  const su2double *sol = solInt + i*NPad + llNVar;
6929  const su2double *normals = surfElem[lll].metricNormalsFace.data()
6930  + i*(nDim+1);
6931  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[lll].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
6932  + i*nDim;
6933 
6934  /*--- Compute the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
6935  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/sol[0];
6936  const su2double u = sol[1]*DensityInv;
6937  const su2double v = sol[2]*DensityInv;
6938  const su2double StaticEnergy = sol[3]*DensityInv - 0.5*(u*u + v*v);
6939 
6940  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
6941  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
6942 
6943  /*-- Compute the vector from the reference point to the integration
6944  point and update the inviscid force. Note that the normal points
6945  into the geometry, hence no minus sign. ---*/
6946  const su2double DistX = Coord[0] - Origin[0];
6947  const su2double DistY = Coord[1] - Origin[1];
6948 
6949  const su2double ForceMag = (Pressure - Pressure_Inf)*weights[i]
6950  * normals[nDim]*factor;
6951  const su2double ForceX = ForceMag*normals[0];
6952  const su2double ForceY = ForceMag*normals[1];
6953 
6954  ForceInviscid[0] += ForceX;
6955  ForceInviscid[1] += ForceY;
6956 
6957  /*--- Update the inviscid moment. ---*/
6958  MomentInviscid[2] += (ForceY*DistX - ForceX*DistY)/RefLength;
6959  }
6960  }
6961 
6962  break;
6963  }
6964 
6965  /*----------------------------------------------------------------*/
6966 
6967  case 3: {
6968 
6969  /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
6970  simultaneously. */
6971  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6972  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6973  const unsigned long lll = l + ll;
6974 
6975  /* Loop over the integration points of this surface element. */
6976  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6977 
6978  /* Easier storage of the solution, the normals and the coordinates
6979  for this integration point. */
6980  const su2double *sol = solInt + i*NPad + llNVar;
6981  const su2double *normals = surfElem[lll].metricNormalsFace.data()
6982  + i*(nDim+1);
6983  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[lll].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
6984  + i*nDim;
6985 
6986  /*--- Compute the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
6987  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/sol[0];
6988  const su2double u = sol[1]*DensityInv;
6989  const su2double v = sol[2]*DensityInv;
6990  const su2double w = sol[3]*DensityInv;
6991  const su2double StaticEnergy = sol[4]*DensityInv - 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
6992 
6993  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
6994  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
6995 
6996  /*-- Compute the vector from the reference point to the integration
6997  point and update the inviscid force. Note that the normal points
6998  into the geometry, hence no minus sign. ---*/
6999  const su2double DistX = Coord[0] - Origin[0];
7000  const su2double DistY = Coord[1] - Origin[1];
7001  const su2double DistZ = Coord[2] - Origin[2];
7002 
7003  const su2double ForceMag = (Pressure - Pressure_Inf)*weights[i]
7004  * normals[nDim]*factor;
7005  const su2double ForceX = ForceMag*normals[0];
7006  const su2double ForceY = ForceMag*normals[1];
7007  const su2double ForceZ = ForceMag*normals[2];
7008 
7009  ForceInviscid[0] += ForceX;
7010  ForceInviscid[1] += ForceY;
7011  ForceInviscid[2] += ForceZ;
7012 
7013  /*--- Update the inviscid moment. ---*/
7014  MomentInviscid[0] += (ForceZ*DistY - ForceY*DistZ)/RefLength;
7015  MomentInviscid[1] += (ForceX*DistZ - ForceZ*DistX)/RefLength;
7016  MomentInviscid[2] += (ForceY*DistX - ForceX*DistY)/RefLength;
7017  }
7018  }
7019 
7020  break;
7021  }
7022  }
7023 
7024  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
7025  current chunk. */
7026  l = lEnd;
7027  }
7028 
7029  /*--- Project forces and store the non-dimensional coefficients ---*/
7030  if(nDim == 2) {
7031  CD_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0]*cos(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[1]*sin(Alpha);
7032  CL_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[1]*cos(Alpha);
7033  CEff_Inv[iMarker] = CL_Inv[iMarker] / (CD_Inv[iMarker]+EPS);
7034  CMz_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[2];
7035  CFx_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0];
7036  CFy_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[1];
7037  }
7038  if(nDim == 3) {
7039  CD_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0]*cos(Alpha)*cos(Beta)
7040  + ForceInviscid[1]*sin(Beta)
7041  + ForceInviscid[2]*sin(Alpha)*cos(Beta);
7042  CL_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[2]*cos(Alpha);
7043  CSF_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Beta)*cos(Alpha)
7044  + ForceInviscid[1]*cos(Beta)
7045  - ForceInviscid[2]*sin(Beta)*sin(Alpha);
7046  CEff_Inv[iMarker] = CL_Inv[iMarker] / (CD_Inv[iMarker] + EPS);
7047  CMx_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[0];
7048  CMy_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[1];
7049  CMz_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[2];
7050  CFx_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0];
7051  CFy_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[1];
7052  CFz_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[2];
7053  }
7054 
7055  AllBound_CD_Inv += CD_Inv[iMarker];
7056  AllBound_CL_Inv += CL_Inv[iMarker];
7057  AllBound_CSF_Inv += CSF_Inv[iMarker];
7058  AllBound_CEff_Inv = AllBound_CL_Inv / (AllBound_CD_Inv + EPS);
7059  AllBound_CMx_Inv += CMx_Inv[iMarker];
7060  AllBound_CMy_Inv += CMy_Inv[iMarker];
7061  AllBound_CMz_Inv += CMz_Inv[iMarker];
7062  AllBound_CFx_Inv += CFx_Inv[iMarker];
7063  AllBound_CFy_Inv += CFy_Inv[iMarker];
7064  AllBound_CFz_Inv += CFz_Inv[iMarker];
7065 
7066  /*--- Compute the coefficients per surface ---*/
7067  for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
7068  ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
7069  string Monitoring_Tag = config->GetMarker_Monitoring_TagBound(iMarker_Monitoring);
7070  string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
7071  if (Marker_Tag == Monitoring_Tag) {
7072  Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CL_Inv[iMarker];
7073  Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CD_Inv[iMarker];
7074  Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CSF_Inv[iMarker];
7075  Surface_CEff_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring]
7076  / (Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] + EPS);
7077  Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFx_Inv[iMarker];
7078  Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFy_Inv[iMarker];
