7079  Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFz_Inv[iMarker];
7080  Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMx_Inv[iMarker];
7081  Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMy_Inv[iMarker];
7082  Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMz_Inv[iMarker];
7083  }
7084  }
7085  }
7086  }
7087  }
7088 
7089 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
7090 
7091  /*--- Parallel mode. The data from all ranks must be gathered.
7092  Determine the size of the communication buffer. ---*/
7093  const unsigned long nCommSize = 9*config->GetnMarker_Monitoring() + 9;
7094 
7095  /*--- Define the communication buffers and store to local data in
7096  the local buffer. ---*/
7097  vector<su2double> locBuf(nCommSize), globBuf(nCommSize);
7098 
7099  unsigned long ii = 0;
7100  locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CD_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CL_Inv;
7101  locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CSF_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMx_Inv;
7102  locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMy_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMz_Inv;
7103  locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFx_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFy_Inv;
7104  locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFz_Inv;
7105 
7106  for(unsigned short i=0; i<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++i) {
7107  locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CL_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CD_Inv[i];
7108  locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CSF_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFx_Inv[i];
7109  locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFy_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFz_Inv[i];
7110  locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMx_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMy_Inv[i];
7111  locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMz_Inv[i];
7112  }
7113 
7114  /* Sum up all the data from all ranks. The result will be available on all ranks. */
7115  if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
7116  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(locBuf.data(), globBuf.data(), nCommSize, MPI_DOUBLE,
7117  MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7118  }
7119 
7120  /*--- Copy the data back from globBuf into the required variables. ---*/
7121  ii = 0;
7122  AllBound_CD_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CL_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7123  AllBound_CSF_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CMx_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7124  AllBound_CMy_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CMz_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7125  AllBound_CFx_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CFy_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7126  AllBound_CFz_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7127 
7128  AllBound_CEff_Inv = AllBound_CL_Inv/(AllBound_CD_Inv + EPS);
7129 
7130  for(unsigned short i=0; i<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++i) {
7131  Surface_CL_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CD_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7132  Surface_CSF_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CFx_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7133  Surface_CFy_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CFz_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7134  Surface_CMx_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CMy_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7135  Surface_CMz_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7136 
7137  Surface_CEff_Inv[i] = Surface_CL_Inv[i]/(Surface_CD_Inv[i] + EPS);
7138  }
7139 
7140 #endif
7141 
7142  /*--- Update the total coefficients (note that all the nodes have the same value) ---*/
7143  Total_CD = AllBound_CD_Inv;
7144  Total_CL = AllBound_CL_Inv;
7145  Total_CSF = AllBound_CSF_Inv;
7146  Total_CEff = Total_CL / (Total_CD + EPS);
7147  Total_CMx = AllBound_CMx_Inv;
7148  Total_CMy = AllBound_CMy_Inv;
7149  Total_CMz = AllBound_CMz_Inv;
7150  Total_CFx = AllBound_CFx_Inv;
7151  Total_CFy = AllBound_CFy_Inv;
7152  Total_CFz = AllBound_CFz_Inv;
7153 
7154  /*--- Update the total coefficients per surface (note that all the nodes have the same value)---*/
7155  for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
7156  ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
7157  Surface_CL[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7158  Surface_CD[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7159  Surface_CSF[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7160  Surface_CEff[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring]
7161  / (Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] + EPS);
7162  Surface_CFx[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7163  Surface_CFy[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7164  Surface_CFz[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7165  Surface_CMx[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7166  Surface_CMy[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7167  Surface_CMz[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7168  }
7169 }
7170 
7171 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ExplicitRK_Iteration(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
7172  CConfig *config, unsigned short iRKStep) {
7173 
7174  const su2double RK_AlphaCoeff = config->Get_Alpha_RKStep(iRKStep);
7175  const unsigned short nRKStages = config->GetnRKStep();
7176 
7177  SetResToZero();
7178 
7179  /* Set the pointer to the array where the new state vector must be stored.
7180  If this is the last RK step, the solution should be stored in
7181  VecSolDOFs, such that a new time step can be taken. Otherwise, the
7182  solution should be stored in the first time level of the working vectors
7183  for the solution. Note that only one working vector will be present for a
7184  RK scheme, because time accurate local time stepping is not possible yet
7185  with RK schemes. */
7186  su2double *solNew;
7187  if(iRKStep == (nRKStages-1)) solNew = VecSolDOFs.data();
7188  else solNew = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
7189 
7190  /*--- Update the solution by looping over the owned volume elements. ---*/
7191  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7192 
7193  /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7194  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7195  const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7196  const su2double *solDOFsOld = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7197  su2double *solDOFs = solNew + offset;
7198 
7199  /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution. */
7200  const su2double tmp = RK_AlphaCoeff*VecDeltaTime[l];
7201  const unsigned short nVarNDOFs = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
7202 
7203  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j)
7204  solDOFs[j] = solDOFsOld[j] - tmp*res[j];
7205  }
7206 
7207  /*--- Test for the last RK step. ---*/
7208  if(iRKStep == (nRKStages-1)) {
7209 
7210  /*--- Compute the root mean square residual. Note that the SetResidual_RMS
7211  function of CSolver cannot be used, because that is for the FV solver. ---*/
7212  SetResidual_RMS_FEM(geometry, config);
7213 
7214  /*--- For verification cases, compute the global error metrics. ---*/
7215  ComputeVerificationError(geometry, config);
7216  }
7217 }
7218 
7219 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ClassicalRK4_Iteration(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
7220  CConfig *config, unsigned short iRKStep) {
7221 
7222  /*--- Hard-coded classical RK4 coefficients. Will be added to config. ---*/
7223  su2double RK_FuncCoeff[4] = {1.0/6.0, 1.0/3.0, 1.0/3.0, 1.0/6.0};
7224  su2double RK_TimeCoeff[4] = {0.5, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0};
7225 
7226  SetResToZero();
7227 
7228  /*--- Update the solution by looping over the owned volume elements. ---*/
7229  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7230 
7231  /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7232  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7233  const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7234  const su2double *solDOFsOld = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7235  su2double *solDOFsNew = VecSolDOFsNew.data() + offset;
7236 
7237  su2double *solDOFs;
7238  if(iRKStep < 3) solDOFs = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data() + offset;
7239  else solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7240 
7241  /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution and the L2 norm. */
7242  const su2double tmp_time = -1.0*RK_TimeCoeff[iRKStep]*VecDeltaTime[l];
7243  const su2double tmp_func = -1.0*RK_FuncCoeff[iRKStep]*VecDeltaTime[l];
7244 
7245  const unsigned short nVarNDOFs = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
7246 
7247  if (iRKStep < 3) {
7248  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j) {
7249  solDOFsNew[j] += tmp_func*res[j];
7250  solDOFs[j] = solDOFsOld[j] + tmp_time*res[j];
7251  }
7252  }
7253  else {
7254  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j)
7255  solDOFs[j] = solDOFsNew[j] + tmp_func*res[j];
7256  }
7257  }
7258 
7259  /*--- Test for the last RK step. ---*/
7260  if(iRKStep == 3) {
7261 
7262  /*--- Compute the root mean square residual. Note that the SetResidual_RMS
7263  function of CSolver cannot be used, because that is for the FV solver. ---*/
7264  SetResidual_RMS_FEM(geometry, config);
7265 
7266  /*--- For verification cases, compute the global error metrics. ---*/
7267  ComputeVerificationError(geometry, config);
7268  }
7269 }
7270 
7271 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetResidual_RMS_FEM(CGeometry *geometry,
7272  CConfig *config) {
7273 
7274  /* Initialize the residuals to zero. */
7275  SetResToZero();
7276 
7277  /*--- Loop over the owned elements. It is not possible to loop directly over the owned
7278  DOFs, because the coordinates of the DOFs are only known in the volume class. ---*/
7279  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7280 
7281  /* Set the pointer for the residual for this element. */
7282  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7283  const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7284 
7285  /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the norms. */
7286  unsigned int i = 0;
7287  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
7288  const unsigned long globalIndex = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolGlobal + j;
7289  const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
7290 
7291  for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar, ++i) {
7292 
7293  Residual_RMS[iVar] += res[i]*res[i];
7294  AddRes_Max(iVar, fabs(res[i]), globalIndex, coor);
7295  }
7296  }
7297  }
7298 
7299 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
7300  /* Parallel mode. Disable the reduce for the residual to avoid overhead if requested. */
7301  if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
7302 
7303  /*--- The local L2 norms must be added to obtain the
7304  global value. Also check for divergence. ---*/
7305  vector<su2double> rbufRes(nVar);
7306  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(Residual_RMS.data(), rbufRes.data(), nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7307 
7308  for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7309  if (rbufRes[iVar] != rbufRes[iVar])
7310  SU2_MPI::Error("SU2 has diverged. (NaN detected)", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
7311 
7312  Residual_RMS[iVar] = max(EPS*EPS, sqrt(rbufRes[iVar]/nDOFsGlobal));
7313  }
7314 
7315  /*--- The global maximum norms must be obtained. ---*/
7316  rbufRes.resize(nVar*size);
7317  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Residual_Max.data(), nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, rbufRes.data(),
7318  nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7319 
7320  vector<unsigned long> rbufPoint(nVar*size);
7321  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Point_Max.data(), nVar, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, rbufPoint.data(),
7322  nVar, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7323 
7324  vector<su2double> sbufCoor(nDim*nVar);
7325  for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7326  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7327  sbufCoor[iVar*nDim+iDim] = Point_Max_Coord[iVar][iDim];
7328  }
7329 
7330  vector<su2double> rbufCoor(nDim*nVar*size);
7331  SU2_MPI::Allgather(sbufCoor.data(), nVar*nDim, MPI_DOUBLE, rbufCoor.data(),
7332  nVar*nDim, MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7333 
7334  for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7335  for(int proc=0; proc<size; ++proc)
7336  AddRes_Max(iVar, rbufRes[proc*nVar+iVar], rbufPoint[proc*nVar+iVar],
7337  &rbufCoor[proc*nVar*nDim+iVar*nDim]);
7338  }
7339  }
7340 
7341 #else
7342  /*--- Sequential mode. Check for a divergence of the solver and compute
7343  the L2-norm of the residuals. ---*/
7344  for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7345 
7346  if(GetRes_RMS(iVar) != GetRes_RMS(iVar))
7347  SU2_MPI::Error("SU2 has diverged. (NaN detected)", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
7348 
7349  Residual_RMS[iVar] = max(EPS*EPS, sqrt(GetRes_RMS(iVar)/nDOFsGlobal));
7350  }
7351 
7352 #endif
7353 }
7354 
7355 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeVerificationError(CGeometry *geometry,
7356  CConfig *config) {
7357 
7358  /*--- The errors only need to be computed on the finest grid. ---*/
7359  if(MGLevel != MESH_0) return;
7360 
7361  /*--- If this is a verification case, we can compute the global
7362  error metrics by using the difference between the local error
7363  and the known solution at each DOF. This is then collected into
7364  RMS (L2) and maximum (Linf) global error norms. From these
7365  global measures, one can compute the order of accuracy. ---*/
7366 
7367  bool write_heads = ((((config->GetTimeIter() % (config->GetScreen_Wrt_Freq(2)*40)) == 0)
7368  && (config->GetTimeIter()!= 0))
7369  || (config->GetTimeIter() == 1));
7370  if( !write_heads ) return;
7371 
7372  /*--- Check if there actually is an exact solution for this
7373  verification case, if computed at all. ---*/
7374  if (VerificationSolution) {
7375  if (VerificationSolution->ExactSolutionKnown()) {
7376 
7377  /*--- Get the physical time if necessary. ---*/
7378  su2double time = 0.0;
7379  if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
7380 
7381  /*--- Reset the global error measures to zero. ---*/
7382  for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
7383  VerificationSolution->SetError_RMS(iVar, 0.0);
7384  VerificationSolution->SetError_Max(iVar, 0.0, 0);
7385  }
7386 
7387  /*--- Loop over the owned elements. It is not possible to loop directly over the owned
7388  DOFs, because the coordinates of the DOFs are only known in the volume element class. ---*/
7389  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7390 
7391  /* Set the pointer for the solution for this element. */
7392  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7393  const su2double *solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7394 
7395  /* Loop over the DOFs for this element. */
7396  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
7397  const unsigned long globalIndex = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolGlobal + j;
7398  const su2double *solDOF = solDOFs + j*nVar;
7399  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
7400 
7401  /* Get local error from the verification solution class. */
7402  vector<su2double> error(nVar,0.0);
7403  VerificationSolution->GetLocalError(coor, time, solDOF, error.data());
7404 
7405  /* Increment the global error measures */
7406  for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
7407  VerificationSolution->AddError_RMS(iVar, error[iVar]*error[iVar]);
7408  VerificationSolution->AddError_Max(iVar, fabs(error[iVar]), globalIndex, coor);
7409  }
7410  }
7411  }
7412 
7413  /* Finalize the calculation of the global error measures. */
7414  VerificationSolution->SetVerificationError(nDOFsGlobal, config);
7415 
7416  /*--- Screen output of the error metrics. This can be improved
7417  once the new output classes are in place. ---*/
7418 
7419  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
7420 
7421  cout.precision(5);
7422  cout.setf(ios::scientific, ios::floatfield);
7423 
7424  if (!config->GetDiscrete_Adjoint()) {
7425 
7426  cout << endl << "------------------------ Global Error Analysis --------------------------" << endl;
7427 
7428  cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [Rho]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(0) << " | ";
7429  cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [Rho]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(0);
7430  cout << endl;
7431 
7432  cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoU]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(1) << " | ";
7433  cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoU]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(1);
7434  cout << endl;
7435 
7436  cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoV]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(2) << " | ";
7437  cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoV]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(2);
7438  cout << endl;
7439 
7440  if (nDim == 3) {
7441  cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoW]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(3) << " | ";
7442  cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoW]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(3);
7443  cout << endl;
7444  }
7445 
7446  cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoE]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(nDim+1) << " | ";
7447  cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoE]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(nDim+1);
7448  cout << endl;
7449 
7450  cout << "-------------------------------------------------------------------------" << endl << endl;
7451  cout.unsetf(ios_base::floatfield);
7452 
7453  }
7454  }
7455  }
7456  }
7457 }
7458 
7459 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_Iteration(const unsigned long elemBeg,
7460  const unsigned long elemEnd) {
7461 
7462  /*--- Update the solution by looping over the given range
7463  of volume elements. ---*/
7464  for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
7465 
7466  /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7467  const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7468  su2double *res = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + offset;
7469  su2double *solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7470 
7471  /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution.
7472  Initialize the residual to zero afterwards. */
7473  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i) {
7474  solDOFs[i] -= VecDeltaTime[l]*res[i];
7475  res[i] = 0.0;
7476  }
7477  }
7478 }
7479 
7480 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Euler_Wall(CConfig *config,
7481  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7482  const unsigned short NPad,
7483  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7484  const su2double *solIntL,
7485  su2double *solIntR) {
7486 
7487  /*--- Apply the inviscid wall boundary conditions to compute the right
7488  state in the integration points. There are two options. Either the
7489  normal velocity is negated or the normal velocity is set to zero,
7490  relative to the grid motion. Some experiments are needed to see which
7491  formulation gives better results. ---*/
7492 
7493  /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7494  same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7495  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7496  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7497 
7498  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7499  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7500  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7501 
7502  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7503  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7504 
7505  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the normals and the
7506  grid velocity for this integration point. */
7507  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7508  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7509  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7510  const su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
7511 
7512  /* Compute the normal component of the momentum variables, relative
7513  to the grid motion. */
7514  su2double rVn = 0.0;
7515  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7516  rVn += (UL[iDim+1]-UL[0]*gridVel[iDim])*normals[iDim];
7517 
7518  /* If the normal velocity must be mirrored instead of set to zero,
7519  the normal component that must be subtracted must be doubled. If the
7520  normal velocity must be set to zero, simply comment this line. */
7521  //rVn *= 2.0;
7522 
7523  /* Set the right state. The initial value of the total energy is the
7524  energy of the left state. */
7525  UR[0] = UL[0];
7526  UR[nDim+1] = UL[nDim+1];
7527  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7528  UR[iDim+1] = UL[iDim+1] - rVn*normals[iDim];
7529 
7530  /*--- Actually, only the internal energy of UR is equal to UL. If the
7531  kinetic energy differs for UL and UR, the difference must be
7532  subtracted from the total energy of UR to obtain the correct
7533  value. ---*/
7534  su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7535  su2double diffKin = 0;
7536  for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
7537  const su2double velL = DensityInv*UL[iDim];
7538  const su2double velR = DensityInv*UR[iDim];
7539  diffKin += velL*velL - velR*velR;
7540  }
7541 
7542  UR[nDim+1] -= 0.5*UL[0]*diffKin;
7543  }
7544  }
7545 }
7546 
7547 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Inlet(CConfig *config,
7548  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7549  const unsigned short NPad,
7550  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7551  unsigned short val_marker,
7552  const su2double *solIntL,
7553  su2double *solIntR) {
7554 
7555  /*--- Retrieve the specified total conditions for this inlet. ---*/
7556  string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7557 
7558  su2double P_Total = config->GetInlet_Ptotal(Marker_Tag);
7559  su2double T_Total = config->GetInlet_Ttotal(Marker_Tag);
7560  auto Flow_Dir = config->GetInlet_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7561 
7562  /*--- Non-dim. the inputs if necessary, and compute the total enthalpy. ---*/
7563  P_Total /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7564  T_Total /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7565 
7566  su2double Gas_Constant = config->GetGas_ConstantND();
7567  su2double H_Total = (Gamma*Gas_Constant/Gamma_Minus_One)*T_Total;
7568 
7569  /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7570  same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7571  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7572  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7573 
7574  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7575  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7576  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7577 
7578  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7579  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7580 
7581  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
7582  for this integration point. */
7583  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7584  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7585  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7586 
7587  /*--- Compute the normal velocity, the speed of sound squared and
7588  the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
7589  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7590  su2double VelocityNormal = 0.0, Velocity2 = 0.0;
7591  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7592  const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv;
7593  VelocityNormal += vel*normals[iDim];
7594  Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7595  }
7596 
7597  su2double StaticEnergy = UL[nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
7598 
7599  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], StaticEnergy);
7600  su2double SoundSpeed2 = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed2();
7601  su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
7602 
7603  /*--- Compute the Riemann invariant to be extrapolated. ---*/
7604  const su2double Riemann = 2.0*sqrt(SoundSpeed2)/Gamma_Minus_One + VelocityNormal;
7605 
7606  /*--- Total speed of sound. The expression below is also valid for variable cp,
7607  although a linearization around the value of the left state is performed. ---*/
7608  const su2double SoundSpeed_Total2 = Gamma_Minus_One*(H_Total - DensityInv*(UL[nDim+1] + Pressure)
7609  + 0.5*Velocity2) + SoundSpeed2;
7610 
7611  /*--- Dot product of normal and flow direction. This should be
7612  negative due to outward facing boundary normal convention. ---*/
7613  su2double alpha = 0.0;
7614  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7615  alpha += normals[iDim]*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7616 
7617  /*--- Coefficients in the quadratic equation for the magnitude of the velocity. ---*/
7618  const su2double aa = 1.0 + 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*alpha*alpha;
7619  const su2double bb = -1.0*Gamma_Minus_One*alpha*Riemann;
7620  const su2double cc = 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Riemann*Riemann
7621  - 2.0*SoundSpeed_Total2/Gamma_Minus_One;
7622 
7623  /*--- Solve the equation for the magnitude of the velocity. As this value
7624  must be positive and both aa and bb are positive (alpha is negative and
7625  Riemann is positive up till Mach = 5.0 or so, which is not really subsonic
7626  anymore), it is clear which of the two possible solutions must be taken.
7627  Some clipping is present, but this is normally not active. ---*/
7628  su2double dd = bb*bb - 4.0*aa*cc; dd = sqrt(max(0.0, dd));
7629  su2double Vel_Mag = (-bb + dd)/(2.0*aa); Vel_Mag = max(0.0, Vel_Mag);
7630  Velocity2 = Vel_Mag*Vel_Mag;
7631 
7632  /*--- Compute speed of sound from total speed of sound eqn. ---*/
7633  SoundSpeed2 = SoundSpeed_Total2 - 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Velocity2;
7634 
7635  /*--- Mach squared (cut between 0-1), use to adapt velocity ---*/
7636  su2double Mach2 = Velocity2/SoundSpeed2; Mach2 = min(1.0, Mach2);
7637 
7638  Velocity2 = Mach2*SoundSpeed2;
7639  Vel_Mag = sqrt(Velocity2);
7640 
7641  /*--- Static temperature from the speed of sound relation. ---*/
7642  SoundSpeed2 = SoundSpeed_Total2 - 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Velocity2;
7643 
7644  const su2double Temperature = SoundSpeed2/(Gamma*Gas_Constant);
7645 
7646  /*--- Static pressure using isentropic relation at a point ---*/
7647  Pressure = P_Total*pow((Temperature/T_Total), Gamma/Gamma_Minus_One);
7648 
7649  /*--- Density at the inlet from the gas law ---*/
7650  const su2double Density = Pressure/(Gas_Constant*Temperature);
7651 
7652  /*--- Store the conservative variables in UR. ---*/
7653  UR[0] = Density;
7654  UR[nDim+1] = Pressure/Gamma_Minus_One + 0.5*Density*Velocity2;
7655 
7656  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7657  UR[iDim+1] = Density*Vel_Mag*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7658  }
7659  }
7660 }
7661 
7662 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Outlet(CConfig *config,
7663  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7664  const unsigned short NPad,
7665  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7666  unsigned short val_marker,
7667  const su2double *solIntL,
7668  su2double *solIntR) {
7669 
7670  /*--- Retrieve the specified back pressure for this outlet.
7671  Nondimensionalize, if necessary. ---*/
7672  string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7673 
7674  su2double P_Exit = config->GetOutlet_Pressure(Marker_Tag);
7675  P_Exit = P_Exit/config->GetPressure_Ref();
7676 
7677  /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7678  same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7679  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7680  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7681 
7682  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7683  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7684  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7685 
7686  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7687  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7688 
7689  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
7690  for this integration point. */
7691  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7692  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7693  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7694 
7695  /*--- Compute the normal velocity, the speed of sound squared and
7696  the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
7697  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7698  su2double VelocityNormal = 0.0, Velocity2 = 0.0;
7699  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7700  const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv;
7701  VelocityNormal += vel*normals[iDim];
7702  Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7703  }
7704 
7705  su2double StaticEnergy = UL[nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
7706 
7707  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], StaticEnergy);
7708  su2double SoundSpeed2 = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed2();
7709  su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
7710 
7711  /*--- Subsonic exit flow: there is one incoming characteristic,
7712  therefore one variable can be specified (back pressure) and is used
7713  to update the conservative variables. Compute the entropy and the
7714  acoustic Riemann variable. These invariants, as well as the
7715  tangential velocity components, are extrapolated. ---*/
7716  const su2double Entropy = Pressure*pow(DensityInv, Gamma);
7717  const su2double Riemann = 2.0*sqrt(SoundSpeed2)/Gamma_Minus_One + VelocityNormal;
7718 
7719  /*--- Compute the density and normal velocity of the right state. ---*/
7720  const su2double Density = pow(P_Exit/Entropy,1.0/Gamma);
7721  const su2double SoundSpeed = sqrt(Gamma*P_Exit/Density);
7722  const su2double Vn_Exit = Riemann - 2.0*SoundSpeed/Gamma_Minus_One;
7723 
7724  /*--- Store the conservative variables in UR. ---*/
7725  Velocity2 = 0.0;
7726  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7727  const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv
7728  + (Vn_Exit-VelocityNormal)*normals[iDim];
7729  Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7730  UR[iDim+1] = Density*vel;
7731  }
7732 
7733  UR[0] = Density;
7734  UR[nDim+1] = Pressure/Gamma_Minus_One + 0.5*Density*Velocity2;
7735  }
7736  }
7737 }
7738 
7739 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Riemann(CConfig *config,
7740  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7741  const unsigned short NPad,
7742  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7743  unsigned short val_marker,
7744  const su2double *solIntL,
7745  su2double *solIntR) {
7746 
7747  /* Retrieve the corresponding string for this marker. */
7748  string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7749 
7750  /* Determine the number of integration points for the face, which is
7751  the same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7752  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7753  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7754 
7755  /*--- Make a distinction between the different type of boundary conditions
7756  and set the initial guess of the right states in the integration
7757  points of the face. ---*/
7758  switch( config->GetKind_Data_Riemann(Marker_Tag) ) {
7759  case TOTAL_CONDITIONS_PT: {
7760 
7761  /* Total conditions specified. Retrieve the non-dimensional total
7762  pressure and temperature as well as the flow direction. */
7763  su2double P_Total = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7764  su2double T_Total = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7765  auto Flow_Dir = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7766 
7767  P_Total /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7768  T_Total /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7769 
7770  /* Compute the total enthalpy and entropy from these values. */
7771  FluidModel->SetTDState_PT(P_Total, T_Total);
7772  const su2double Enthalpy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy()
7773  + FluidModel->GetPressure()/FluidModel->GetDensity();
7774  const su2double Entropy_e = FluidModel->GetEntropy();
7775 
7776  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7777  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7778  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7779 
7780  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7781  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7782 
7783  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7784  for this integration point. */
7785  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7786  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7787 
7788  /* Compute the velocity squared of the left point. This value is
7789  extrapolated and is therefore also the velocity of the right point. */
7790  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7791  su2double Velocity2_e = 0.0;
7792  for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
7793  const su2double vel = UL[iDim]*DensityInv;
7794  Velocity2_e += vel*vel;
7795  }
7796 
7797  /* Determine the static enthalpy, the density and the internal
7798  and total energy per unit mass for the right state. */
7799  const su2double StaticEnthalpy_e = Enthalpy_e - 0.5*Velocity2_e;
7800 
7801  FluidModel->SetTDState_hs(StaticEnthalpy_e, Entropy_e);
7802  const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7803  const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7804  const su2double Energy_e = StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*Velocity2_e;
7805 
7806  /* Set the conservative variables of the right state. */
7807  UR[0] = Density_e;
7808  UR[nDim+1] = Density_e*Energy_e;
7809 
7810  const su2double momTot = Density_e*sqrt(Velocity2_e);
7811  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7812  UR[iDim+1] = momTot*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7813  }
7814  }
7815 
7816  break;
7817  }
7818 
7819  case STATIC_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_PT: {
7820 
7821  /* Supersonic inlet with specified pressure, temperature and Mach
7822  number. Retrieve the non-dimensional static pressure and
7823  temperature as well as the three components of the Mach number. */
7824  su2double P_static = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7825  su2double T_static = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7826  auto Mach = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7827 
7828  P_static /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7829  T_static /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7830 
7831  /* Compute the prescribed density, static energy per unit mass
7832  and speed of sound. */
7833  FluidModel->SetTDState_PT(P_static, T_static);
7834  const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7835  const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7836  const su2double SoundSpeed = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
7837 
7838  /* Determine the magnitude of the Mach number. */
7839  su2double MachMag = 0.0;
7840  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7841  MachMag += Mach[iDim]*Mach[iDim];
7842  MachMag = sqrt(MachMag);
7843 
7844  /* Determine the magnitude of the velocity and the prescribed
7845  conservative variables. */
7846  const su2double VelMag = MachMag*SoundSpeed;
7847 
7848  su2double UCons[5];
7849  UCons[0] = Density_e;
7850  UCons[nDim+1] = Density_e*(StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*VelMag*VelMag);
7851 
7852  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7853  UCons[iDim+1] = Density_e*Mach[iDim]*SoundSpeed;
7854 
7855  /* Loop over the number of faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7856  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7857  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7858 
7859  /* Loop over the integration points and set the right state. */
7860  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7861  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7862  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
7863  UR[mm] = UCons[mm];
7864  }
7865  }
7866 
7867  break;
7868  }
7869 
7870  case STATIC_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_PD: {
7871 
7872  /* Supersonic inlet with specified pressure, temperature and Mach
7873  number. Retrieve the non-dimensional static pressure and
7874  temperature as well as the three components of the Mach number. */
7875  su2double P_static = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7876  su2double Rho_static = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7877  auto Mach = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7878 
7879  P_static /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7880  Rho_static /= config->GetDensity_Ref();
7881 
7882  /* Compute the prescribed pressure, static energy per unit mass
7883  and speed of sound. */
7884  FluidModel->SetTDState_Prho(P_static, Rho_static);
7885  const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7886  const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7887  const su2double SoundSpeed = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
7888 
7889  /* Determine the magnitude of the Mach number. */
7890  su2double MachMag = 0.0;
7891  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7892  MachMag += Mach[iDim]*Mach[iDim];
7893  MachMag = sqrt(MachMag);
7894 
7895  /* Determine the magnitude of the velocity and the prescribed
7896  conservative variables. */
7897  const su2double VelMag = MachMag*SoundSpeed;
7898 
7899  su2double UCons[5];
7900  UCons[0] = Density_e;
7901  UCons[nDim+1] = Density_e*(StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*VelMag*VelMag);
7902 
7903  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7904  UCons[iDim+1] = Density_e*Mach[iDim]*SoundSpeed;
7905 
7906  /* Loop over the number of faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7907  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7908  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7909 
7910  /* Loop over the integration points and set the right state. */
7911  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7912  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7913  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
7914  UR[mm] = UCons[mm];
7915  }
7916  }
7917 
7918  break;
7919  }
7920 
7921  case DENSITY_VELOCITY: {
7922 
7923  /* Subsonic inlet with specified density, velocity magnitude and
7924  flow direction. Retrieve the non-dimensional data. */
7925  su2double Density_e = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7926  su2double VelMag_e = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7927  auto Flow_Dir = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7928 
7929  Density_e /= config->GetDensity_Ref();
7930  VelMag_e /= config->GetVelocity_Ref();
7931 
7932  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7933  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7934  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7935 
7936  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7937  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7938 
7939  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7940  for this integration point. */
7941  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7942  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7943 
7944  /* Compute the total energy per unit mass, which is extrapolated. */
7945  const su2double Energy_e = UL[nDim+1]/UL[0];
7946 
7947  /* Set the conservative variables of the right state. */
7948  UR[0] = Density_e;
7949  UR[nDim+1] = Density_e*Energy_e;
7950 
7951  const su2double momTot = Density_e*VelMag_e;
7952  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7953  UR[iDim+1] = momTot*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7954  }
7955  }
7956 
7957  break;
7958  }
7959 
7960  case STATIC_PRESSURE: {
7961 
7962  /* Subsonic outlet with specified pressure.
7963  Retrieve the non-dimensional data. */
7964  const su2double Pressure_e = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag)
7965  / config->GetPressure_Ref();
7966 
7967  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7968  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7969  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7970 
7971  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7972  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7973 
7974  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7975  for this integration point. */
7976  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7977  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7978 
7979  /* Extrapolate the density and set the thermodynamic state. */
7980  UR[0] = UL[0];
7981  FluidModel->SetTDState_Prho(Pressure_e, UR[0]);
7982 
7983  /* Extrapolate the velocity. As the density is also extrapolated,
7984  this means that the momentum variables are identical for UL and UR.
7985  Also determine the velocity squared. */
7986  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7987  su2double Velocity2_e = 0.0;
7988  for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
7989  UR[iDim] = UL[iDim];
7990 
7991  const su2double vel = UL[iDim]*DensityInv;
7992  Velocity2_e += vel*vel;
7993  }
7994 
7995  /* Compute the total energy per unit volume. */
7996  UR[nDim+1] = UR[0]*(FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy() + 0.5*Velocity2_e);
7997  }
7998  }
7999 
8000  break;
8001  }
8002 
8003  default: {
8004  SU2_MPI::Error("Invalid Riemann input!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8005  }
8006  }
8007 
8008  /***************************************************************************/
8009  /* Correction of the boundary state using a characteristic reconstruction. */
8010  /***************************************************************************/
8011 
8012  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. */
8013  switch( nDim ) {
8014  case 2: {
8015 
8016  /* Two-dimensional simulation.
8017  Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8018  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8019  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8020 
8021  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
8022  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8023 
8024  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8025  for this integration point. */
8026  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
8027  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8028  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8029 
8030  /* Compute the difference in conservative variables. */
8031  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
8032  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
8033  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
8034  const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
8035 
8036  /* Compute the primitive variables of the left state. */
8037  const su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8038  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8039  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8040  const su2double alphaL = 0.5*(vxL*vxL + vyL*vyL);
8041  const su2double eL = tmp*UL[3] - alphaL;
8042 
8043  const su2double nx = normals[0];
8044  const su2double ny = normals[1];
8045  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
8046 
8047  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], eL);
8048 
8049  const su2double aL = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
8050  const su2double a2L = aL*aL;
8051  const su2double pL = FluidModel->GetPressure();
8052  const su2double HL = (UL[3] + pL)*tmp;
8053 
8054  const su2double ovaL = 1.0/aL;
8055  const su2double ova2L = 1.0/a2L;
8056 
8057  /* Compute the eigenvalues. */
8058  su2double lam1 = vnL + aL;
8059  su2double lam2 = vnL - aL;
8060  su2double lam3 = vnL;
8061 
8062  /* For the characteristic reconstruction, only the outgoing
8063  characteristics (negative eigenvalues) must be taken into account.
8064  Set the eigenvalues accordingly. */
8065  lam1 = (lam1 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8066  lam2 = (lam2 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8067  lam3 = (lam3 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8068 
8069  /* Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the reconstruction. */
8070  const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
8071  const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
8072  const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
8073 
8074  const su2double abv4 = Gamma_Minus_One*(alphaL*dr - vxL*dru - vyL*drv + drE);
8075  const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv - vnL*dr;
8076  const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2L + abv2*abv5*ovaL;
8077  const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaL + abv3*abv5;
8078 
8079  /* Compute the right state. */
8080  UR[0] = UL[0] + lam3*dr + abv6;
8081  UR[1] = UL[1] + lam3*dru + vxL*abv6 + nx*abv7;
8082  UR[2] = UL[2] + lam3*drv + vyL*abv6 + ny*abv7;
8083  UR[3] = UL[3] + lam3*drE + HL*abv6 + vnL*abv7;
8084  }
8085  }
8086 
8087  break;
8088  }
8089 
8090  case 3: {
8091 
8092  /* Three-dimensional simulation.
8093  Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8094  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8095  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8096 
8097  /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
8098  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8099 
8100  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8101  for this integration point. */
8102  const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
8103  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8104  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8105 
8106  /* Compute the difference in conservative variables. */
8107  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
8108  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
8109  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
8110  const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
8111  const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
8112 
8113  /* Compute the primitive variables of the left state. */
8114  const su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8115  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8116  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8117  const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
8118  const su2double alphaL = 0.5*(vxL*vxL + vyL*vyL + vzL*vzL);
8119  const su2double eL = tmp*UL[4] - alphaL;
8120 
8121  const su2double nx = normals[0];
8122  const su2double ny = normals[1];
8123  const su2double nz = normals[2];
8124  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
8125 
8126  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], eL);
8127 
8128  const su2double aL = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
8129  const su2double a2L = aL*aL;
8130  const su2double pL = FluidModel->GetPressure();
8131  const su2double HL = (UL[4] + pL)*tmp;
8132 
8133  const su2double ovaL = 1.0/aL;
8134  const su2double ova2L = 1.0/a2L;
8135 
8136  /* Compute the eigenvalues. */
8137  su2double lam1 = vnL + aL;
8138  su2double lam2 = vnL - aL;
8139  su2double lam3 = vnL;
8140 
8141  /* For the characteristic reconstruction, only the outgoing
8142  characteristics (negative eigenvalues) must be taken into account.
8143  Set the eigenvalues accordingly. */
8144  lam1 = (lam1 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8145  lam2 = (lam2 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8146  lam3 = (lam3 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8147 
8148  /* Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the reconstruction. */
8149  const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
8150  const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
8151  const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
8152 
8153  const su2double abv4 = Gamma_Minus_One*(alphaL*dr - vxL*dru - vyL*drv - vzL*drw + drE);
8154  const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv + nz*drw - vnL*dr;
8155  const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2L + abv2*abv5*ovaL;
8156  const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaL + abv3*abv5;
8157 
8158  /* Compute the right state. */
8159  UR[0] = UL[0] + lam3*dr + abv6;
8160  UR[1] = UL[1] + lam3*dru + vxL*abv6 + nx*abv7;
8161  UR[2] = UL[2] + lam3*drv + vyL*abv6 + ny*abv7;
8162  UR[3] = UL[3] + lam3*drw + vzL*abv6 + nz*abv7;
8163  UR[4] = UL[4] + lam3*drE + HL*abv6 + vnL*abv7;
8164  }
8165  }
8166 
8167  break;
8168  }
8169  }
8170 }
8171 
8172 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Euler_Wall(CConfig *config,
8173  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8174  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8175  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8176  su2double *resFaces,
8177  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8178  su2double *workArray) {
8179 
8180  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8181  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8182 
8183  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8184  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8185  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8186  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8187 
8188  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8189  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8190  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8191 
8192  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8193  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8194  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8195  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8196  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8197 
8198  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8199  N value in the gemm computations. */
8200  unsigned long lEnd;
8201  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8202 
8203  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8204  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8205 
8206  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8207  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8208 
8209  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8210  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8211  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8212  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8213 
8214  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8215  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8216  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8217  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8218  work, solIntL);
8219 
8220  /* Compute the right state by applying the inviscid wall BC's. */
8221  BoundaryStates_Euler_Wall(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8222  solIntL, solIntR);
8223 
8224  /* The remainder of the contribution of ths boundary faces to the residual
8225  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8226  be used to carry out this task. */
8227  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8228  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8229 
8230  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8231  current chunk. */
8232  l = lEnd;
8233  }
8234 }
8235 
8236 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Far_Field(CConfig *config,
8237  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8238  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8239  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8240  su2double *resFaces,
8241  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8242  su2double *workArray) {
8243 
8244  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8245  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8246 
8247  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8248  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8249  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8250  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8251 
8252  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8253  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8254  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8255 
8256  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8257  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8258  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8259  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8260  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8261 
8262  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8263  N value in the gemm computations. */
8264  unsigned long lEnd;
8265  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8266 
8267  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8268  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8269 
8270  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8271  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8272 
8273  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8274  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8275  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8276  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8277 
8278  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8279  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8280  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8281  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8282  work, solIntL);
8283 
8284  /* Set the right state in the integration points to the free stream value. */
8285  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8286  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8287  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8288  su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8289  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVar; ++j)
8290  UR[j] = ConsVarFreeStream[j];
8291  }
8292  }
8293 
8294  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8295  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8296  be used to carry out this task. */
8297  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8298  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8299 
8300  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8301  current chunk. */
8302  l = lEnd;
8303  }
8304 }
8305 
8306 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Sym_Plane(CConfig *config,
8307  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8308  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8309  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8310  su2double *resFaces,
8311  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8312  su2double *workArray) {
8313 
8314  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8315  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8316 
8317  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8318  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8319  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8320  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8321 
8322  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8323  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8324  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8325 
8326  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8327  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8328  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8329  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8330  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8331 
8332  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8333  N value in the gemm computations. */
8334  unsigned long lEnd;
8335  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8336 
8337  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8338  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8339 
8340  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8341  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8342 
8343  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8344  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8345  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8346  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8347 
8348  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8349  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8350  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8351  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8352  work, solIntL);
8353 
8354  /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
8355  in order to have the most efficient code. */
8356  switch( nDim ) {
8357 
8358  case 2: {
8359 
8360  /* 2D simulation. Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously
8361  and the integration points to apply the symmetry condition. */
8362  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8363  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8364  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8365 
8366  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8367  for this integration point. */
8368  const su2double *UL = solIntL + NPad*i + llNVar;
8369  su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + llNVar;
8370  const su2double *normals = surfElem[ll+l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8371 
8372  /* Compute twice the normal component of the momentum variables. The
8373  factor 2 comes from the fact that the velocity must be mirrored. */
8374  const su2double rVn = 2.0*(UL[1]*normals[0] + UL[2]*normals[1]);
8375 
8376  /* Set the right state. Note that the total energy of the right state is
8377  identical to the left state, because the magnitude of the velocity
8378  remains the same. */
8379  UR[0] = UL[0];
8380  UR[1] = UL[1] - rVn*normals[0];
8381  UR[2] = UL[2] - rVn*normals[1];
8382  UR[3] = UL[3];
8383  }
8384  }
8385 
8386  break;
8387  }
8388 
8389  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8390 
8391  case 3: {
8392 
8393  /* 3D simulation. Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously
8394  and the integration points to apply the symmetry condition. */
8395  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8396  const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8397  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8398 
8399  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8400  for this integration point. */
8401  const su2double *UL = solIntL + NPad*i + llNVar;
8402  su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + llNVar;
8403  const su2double *normals = surfElem[ll+l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8404 
8405  /* Compute twice the normal component of the momentum variables. The
8406  factor 2 comes from the fact that the velocity must be mirrored. */
8407  const su2double rVn = 2.0*(UL[1]*normals[0] + UL[2]*normals[1] + UL[3]*normals[2]);
8408 
8409  /* Set the right state. Note that the total energy of the right state is
8410  identical to the left state, because the magnitude of the velocity
8411  remains the same. */
8412  UR[0] = UL[0];
8413  UR[1] = UL[1] - rVn*normals[0];
8414  UR[2] = UL[2] - rVn*normals[1];
8415  UR[3] = UL[3] - rVn*normals[2];
8416  UR[4] = UL[4];
8417  }
8418  }
8419 
8420  break;
8421  }
8422  }
8423 
8424  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8425  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8426  be used to carry out this task. */
8427  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8428  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8429 
8430  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8431  current chunk. */
8432  l = lEnd;
8433  }
8434 }
8435 
8436 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Supersonic_Outlet(CConfig *config,
8437  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8438  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8439  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8440  su2double *resFaces,
8441  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8442  su2double *workArray) {
8443 
8444  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8445  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8446 
8447  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8448  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8449  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8450  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8451 
8452  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8453  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8454  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8455 
8456  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8457  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8458  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8459  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8460  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8461 
8462  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8463  N value in the gemm computations. */
8464  unsigned long lEnd;
8465  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8466 
8467  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8468  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8469 
8470  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8471  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8472 
8473  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8474  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8475  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8476  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8477 
8478  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8479  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8480  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8481  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8482  work, solIntL);
8483 
8484  /* Set the right state in the integration points to the left state, i.e.
8485  no boundary condition is applied for a supersonic outlet. */
8486  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<NPad*nInt; ++mm)
8487  solIntR[mm] = solIntL[mm];
8488 
8489  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8490  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8491  be used to carry out this task. */
8492  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8493  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8494 
8495  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8496  current chunk. */
8497  l = lEnd;
8498  }
8499 }
8500 
8501 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Inlet(CConfig *config,
8502  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8503  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8504  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8505  su2double *resFaces,
8506  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8507  unsigned short val_marker,
8508  su2double *workArray) {
8509 
8510  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8511  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8512 
8513  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8514  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8515  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8516  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8517 
8518  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8519  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8520  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8521 
8522  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8523  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8524  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8525  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8526  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8527 
8528  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8529  N value in the gemm computations. */
8530  unsigned long lEnd;
8531  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8532 
8533  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8534  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8535 
8536  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8537  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8538 
8539  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8540  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8541  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8542  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8543 
8544  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8545  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8546  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8547  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8548  work, solIntL);
8549 
8550  /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8551  BoundaryStates_Inlet(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8552 
8553  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8554  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8555  be used to carry out this task. */
8556  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8557  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8558 
8559  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8560  current chunk. */
8561  l = lEnd;
8562  }
8563 }
8564 
8565 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Outlet(CConfig *config,
8566  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8567  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8568  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8569  su2double *resFaces,
8570  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8571  unsigned short val_marker,
8572  su2double *workArray) {
8573 
8574  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8575  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8576 
8577  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8578  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8579  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8580  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8581 
8582  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8583  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8584  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8585 
8586  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8587  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8588  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8589  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8590  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8591 
8592  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8593  N value in the gemm computations. */
8594  unsigned long lEnd;
8595  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8596 
8597  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8598  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8599 
8600  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8601  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8602 
8603  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8604  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8605  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8606  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8607 
8608  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8609  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8610  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8611  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8612  work, solIntL);
8613 
8614  /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8615  BoundaryStates_Outlet(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8616 
8617  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8618  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8619  be used to carry out this task. */
8620  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8621  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8622 
8623  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8624  current chunk. */
8625  l = lEnd;
8626  }
8627 }
8628 
8629 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Riemann(CConfig *config,
8630  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8631  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8632  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8633  su2double *resFaces,
8634  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8635  unsigned short val_marker,
8636  su2double *workArray) {
8637 
8638  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8639  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8640 
8641  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8642  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8643  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8644  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8645 
8646  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8647  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8648  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8649 
8650  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8651  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8652  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8653  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8654  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8655 
8656  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8657  N value in the gemm computations. */
8658  unsigned long lEnd;
8659  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8660 
8661  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8662  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8663 
8664  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8665  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8666 
8667  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8668  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8669  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8670  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8671 
8672  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8673  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8674  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8675  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8676  work, solIntL);
8677 
8678  /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8679  BoundaryStates_Riemann(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8680 
8681  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8682  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8683  be used to carry out this task. */
8684  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8685  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8686 
8687  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8688  current chunk. */
8689  l = lEnd;
8690  }
8691 }
8692 
8693 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Custom(CConfig *config,
8694  const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8695  const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8696  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8697  su2double *resFaces,
8698  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8699  su2double *workArray) {
8700 
8701  /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8702  unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8703 
8704  /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8705  in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8706  const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8707  const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8708 
8709  /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8710  corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8711  const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8712 
8713  /*--- Get the physical time if necessary. ---*/
8714  su2double time = 0.0;
8715  if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
8716 
8717  /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8718  are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8719  multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8720  happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8721  for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8722 
8723  /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8724  N value in the gemm computations. */
8725  unsigned long lEnd;
8726  unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8727 
8728  MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8729  nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8730 
8731  /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8732  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8733 
8734  /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8735  su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8736  su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8737  su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8738 
8739  /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8740  faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8741  function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8742  LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8743  work, solIntL);
8744 
8745  /* Check for a verification solution. */
8746  if( VerificationSolution ) {
8747 
8748  /*--- Loop over the number of simultaneously treated faces and integration points
8749  to compute the right state for the boundary conditions. ---*/
8750  for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8751  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8752 
8753  /* Determine the pointer to the coordinates of this integration
8754  point and the pointer to the solution and call the function
8755  GetBCState to determine the actual boundary state. */
8756  const su2double *coor = surfElem[ll+l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
8757  su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + ll*nVar;
8758 
8759  VerificationSolution->GetBCState(coor, time, UR);
8760  }
8761  }
8762  }
8763  else {
8764 
8765  /* The user must specify the custom BC's here. */
8766  SU2_MPI::Error("Implement customized boundary conditions here.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8767  }
8768 
8769  /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8770  is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8771  be used to carry out this task. */
8772  ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8773  solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8774 
8775  /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8776  current chunk. */
8777  l = lEnd;
8778  }
8779 }
8780 
8781 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(
8782  CConfig *config,
8783  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8784  const unsigned short NPad,
8785  CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8786  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8787  su2double *solInt0,
8788  su2double *solInt1,
8789  su2double *fluxes,
8790  su2double *resFaces,
8791  unsigned long &indResFaces) {
8792 
8793  /*--- Get the required information from the standard face, which is the
8794  same for all faces considered. ---*/
8795  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
8796  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8797  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
8798  const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
8799 
8800  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8801  /*--- Step 1: Compute the fluxes in the integration points using the ---*/
8802  /*--- approximate Riemann solver. ---*/
8803  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8804 
8805  /* Store the normals and grid velocities of the faces in an array of
8806  pointers to be used in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
8807  const su2double* arrNorm[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
8808  const su2double* arrGridVel[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
8809 
8810  if(nFaceSimul > SIZE_ARR_NORM)
8811  SU2_MPI::Error("SIZE_ARR_NORM is too small. Increase it or decrease ALIGNED_BYTES_MATMUL",
8812  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8813 
8814  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8815  arrNorm[l] = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data();
8816  arrGridVel[l] = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data();
8817  }
8818 
8819  /* General function to compute the inviscid fluxes, using an approximate
8820  Riemann solver in the integration points. */
8821  ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(config, nFaceSimul, NPad, nInt, arrNorm, arrGridVel,
8822  solInt0, solInt1, fluxes, conv_numerics);
8823 
8824  /* Multiply the fluxes with the integration weight of the corresponding
8825  integration point. */
8826  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8827  su2double *flux = fluxes + i*NPad;
8828 
8829  for(unsigned short j=0; j<NPad; ++j)
8830  flux[j] *= weights[i];
8831  }
8832 
8833  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8834  /*--- Step 2: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
8835  /*--- integration over the surface element. ---*/
8836  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8837 
8838  /* Get the correct form of the basis functions needed for the matrix
8839  multiplication to compute the residual. */
8840  const su2double *basisFaceTrans = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTranspose();
8841 
8842  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. Use solint0
8843  as temporary storage for the result. */
8844  blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, solInt0, config);
8845 
8846  /* Loop over the number of simultaneously treated faces to store the
8847  residual in the correct locations in resFaces. */
8848  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8849  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8850 
8851  /* Easier storage of the position in the residual array for this face
8852  and update the corresponding counter. */
8853  su2double *resFace = resFaces + indResFaces*nVar;
8854  indResFaces += nDOFs;
8855 
8856  /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
8857  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
8858  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
8859  resFace[nVar*i+mm] = solInt0[NPad*i+llNVar+mm];
8860  }
8861 }
8862 
8863 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(
8864  CConfig *config,
8865  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8866  const unsigned short NPad,
8867  const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8868  su2double *solFace,
8869  su2double *solIntL) {
8870 
8871  /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face, which is the
8872  same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
8873  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
8874  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8875  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
8876  const su2double *basisFace = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
8877 
8878  /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8879  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8880  const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8881 
8882  /* Easier storage of the DOFs of the face. */
8883  const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l].DOFsSolFace.data();
8884 
8885  /* The numbering of the DOFs is given for the entire grid. However, in the
8886  working vectors for the solution a numbering per time level is used.
8887  Therefore an offset must be applied, which can be obtained from the
8888  corresponding volume element. Note that this offset is non-negative. */
8889  const unsigned long volID = surfElem[l].volElemID;
8890  const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[volID].timeLevel;
8891  const unsigned long offset = volElem[volID].offsetDOFsSolLocal
8892  - volElem[volID].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
8893 
8894  /* Copy the solution of the DOFs of the face such that it is contiguous
8895  in memory. */
8896  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
8897 
8898  const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevel].data() + nVar*(DOFs[i]-offset);
8899  su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
8900  for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
8901  sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
8902  }
8903  }
8904 
8905  /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
8906  blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, basisFace, solFace, solIntL, config);
8907 }
8908 
8909 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(CConfig *config,
8910  const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8911  const unsigned short NPad,
8912  const unsigned long nPoints,
8913  const su2double *normalsFace[],
8914  const su2double *gridVelsFace[],
8915  const su2double *solL,
8916  const su2double *solR,
8917  su2double *fluxes,
8918  CNumerics *numerics) {
8919 
8920  /* Easier storage of the specific heat ratio. */
8921  const su2double gm1 = Gamma_Minus_One;
8922 
8923  /* Make a distinction between the several Riemann solvers. */
8924  switch( config->GetRiemann_Solver_FEM() ) {
8925 
8926  case UPWIND::ROE: {
8927 
8928  /* Roe's approximate Riemann solver. Easier storage of the cut off
8929  value for the entropy correction. */
8930  const su2double Delta = config->GetEntropyFix_Coeff();
8931 
8932  /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
8933  in order to have the most efficient code. */
8934  switch( nDim ) {
8935 
8936  case 2: {
8937 
8938  /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
8939  simultaneously. */
8940  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8941 
8942  /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
8943  const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
8944  const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
8945  const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
8946 
8947  /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
8948  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
8949 
8950  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
8951  the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
8952  const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
8953 
8954  const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
8955  const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
8956  const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
8957  const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
8958  su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
8959 
8960  const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], halfArea = 0.5*norm[2];
8961 
8962  /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
8963  const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny;
8964 
8965  /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
8966  su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8967  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8968  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8969  const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[3] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2]));
8970 
8971  tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
8972  const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
8973  const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
8974  const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[3] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2]));
8975 
8976  /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
8977  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
8978  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
