8979  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
8980  const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
8981 
8982  /*--- Compute the Roe average state. ---*/
8983  const su2double zL = sqrt(UL[0]);
8984  const su2double zR = sqrt(UR[0]);
8985  tmp = 1.0/(zL + zR);
8986 
8987  const su2double rHL = UL[3] + pL;
8988  const su2double rHR = UR[3] + pR;
8989 
8990  const su2double uAvg = tmp*(zL*vxL + zR*vxR);
8991  const su2double vAvg = tmp*(zL*vyL + zR*vyR);
8992  const su2double HAvg = tmp*(rHL/zL + rHR/zR);
8993 
8994  /*--- Compute from the Roe average state some variables, which occur
8995  quite often in the matrix vector product to be computed. ---*/
8996  const su2double alphaAvg = 0.5*(uAvg*uAvg + vAvg*vAvg);
8997  tmp = gm1*(HAvg - alphaAvg);
8998  const su2double a2Avg = fabs(tmp);
8999  const su2double aAvg = sqrt(a2Avg);
9000  const su2double vnAvg = uAvg*nx + vAvg*ny;
9001  const su2double unAvg = vnAvg - gridVelNorm;
9002  const su2double ovaAvg = 1.0/aAvg;
9003  const su2double ova2Avg = 1.0/a2Avg;
9004 
9005  /*--- Compute the absolute values of the three eigenvalues and
9006  apply the entropy correction. ---*/
9007  su2double lam1 = fabs(unAvg + aAvg);
9008  su2double lam2 = fabs(unAvg - aAvg);
9009  su2double lam3 = fabs(unAvg);
9010 
9011  tmp = Delta*max(lam1, lam2);
9012  lam1 = max(lam1, tmp);
9013  lam2 = max(lam2, tmp);
9014  lam3 = max(lam3, tmp);
9015 
9016  /*--- Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the dissipation terms. ---*/
9017  const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
9018  const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
9019  const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
9020 
9021  const su2double abv4 = gm1*(alphaAvg*dr - uAvg*dru - vAvg*drv + drE);
9022  const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv - vnAvg*dr;
9023  const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2Avg + abv2*abv5*ovaAvg;
9024  const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaAvg + abv3*abv5;
9025 
9026  /*--- Compute the Roe flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - |A|(UR-UL)). ---*/
9027  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
9028  const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny;
9029  const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9030  const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9031  const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9032 
9033  flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - (lam3*dr + abv6));
9034  flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx
9035  - (lam3*dru + uAvg*abv6 + nx*abv7));
9036  flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny
9037  - (lam3*drv + vAvg*abv6 + ny*abv7));
9038  flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR
9039  - (lam3*drE + HAvg*abv6 + vnAvg*abv7));
9040  }
9041  }
9042 
9043  break;
9044  }
9045 
9046  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9047 
9048  case 3: {
9049 
9050  /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9051  simultaneously. */
9052  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9053 
9054  /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9055  const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9056  const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9057  const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9058 
9059  /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9060  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9061 
9062  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9063  the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9064  const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9065 
9066  const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9067  const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9068  const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9069  const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9070  su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9071 
9072  const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], nz = norm[2];
9073  const su2double halfArea = 0.5*norm[3];
9074 
9075  /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9076  const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny + gridVel[2]*nz;
9077 
9078  /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9079  su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9080  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9081  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9082  const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
9083  const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[4] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2] + vzL*UL[3]));
9084 
9085  tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9086  const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9087  const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9088  const su2double vzR = tmp*UR[3];
9089  const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[4] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2] + vzR*UR[3]));
9090 
9091  /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9092  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9093  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9094  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9095  const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
9096  const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
9097 
9098  /*--- Compute the Roe average state. ---*/
9099  const su2double zL = sqrt(UL[0]);
9100  const su2double zR = sqrt(UR[0]);
9101  tmp = 1.0/(zL + zR);
9102 
9103  const su2double rHL = UL[4] + pL;
9104  const su2double rHR = UR[4] + pR;
9105 
9106  const su2double uAvg = tmp*(zL*vxL + zR*vxR);
9107  const su2double vAvg = tmp*(zL*vyL + zR*vyR);
9108  const su2double wAvg = tmp*(zL*vzL + zR*vzR);
9109  const su2double HAvg = tmp*(rHL/zL + rHR/zR);
9110 
9111  /*--- Compute from the Roe average state some variables, which occur
9112  quite often in the matrix vector product to be computed. ---*/
9113  const su2double alphaAvg = 0.5*(uAvg*uAvg + vAvg*vAvg + wAvg*wAvg);
9114  tmp = gm1*(HAvg - alphaAvg);
9115  const su2double a2Avg = fabs(tmp);
9116  const su2double aAvg = sqrt(a2Avg);
9117  const su2double vnAvg = uAvg*nx + vAvg*ny + wAvg*nz;
9118  const su2double unAvg = vnAvg - gridVelNorm;
9119  const su2double ovaAvg = 1.0/aAvg;
9120  const su2double ova2Avg = 1.0/a2Avg;
9121 
9122  /*--- Compute the absolute values of the three eigenvalues and
9123  apply the entropy correction. ---*/
9124  su2double lam1 = fabs(unAvg + aAvg);
9125  su2double lam2 = fabs(unAvg - aAvg);
9126  su2double lam3 = fabs(unAvg);
9127 
9128  tmp = Delta*max(lam1, lam2);
9129  lam1 = max(lam1, tmp);
9130  lam2 = max(lam2, tmp);
9131  lam3 = max(lam3, tmp);
9132 
9133  /*--- Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the dissipation terms. ---*/
9134  const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
9135  const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
9136  const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
9137 
9138  const su2double abv4 = gm1*(alphaAvg*dr - uAvg*dru - vAvg*drv -wAvg*drw + drE);
9139  const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv + nz*drw - vnAvg*dr;
9140  const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2Avg + abv2*abv5*ovaAvg;
9141  const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaAvg + abv3*abv5;
9142 
9143  /*--- Compute the Roe flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - |A|(UR-UL)). ---*/
9144  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
9145  const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny + vzR*nz;
9146  const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9147  const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9148  const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9149 
9150  flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - (lam3*dr + abv6));
9151  flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx
9152  - (lam3*dru + uAvg*abv6 + nx*abv7));
9153  flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny
9154  - (lam3*drv + vAvg*abv6 + ny*abv7));
9155  flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pa*nz
9156  - (lam3*drw + wAvg*abv6 + nz*abv7));
9157  flux[4] = halfArea*(UL[4]*unL + UR[4]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR
9158  - (lam3*drE + HAvg*abv6 + vnAvg*abv7));
9159  }
9160  }
9161 
9162  break;
9163  }
9164  }
9165 
9166  break;
9167  }
9168 
9169  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9170 
9171  case UPWIND::LAX_FRIEDRICH: {
9172 
9173  /* Local Lax-Friedrich (Rusanov) flux Make a distinction between two and
9174  three space dimensions in order to have the most efficient code. */
9175  switch( nDim ) {
9176 
9177  case 2: {
9178 
9179  /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9180  simultaneously. */
9181  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9182 
9183  /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9184  const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9185  const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9186  const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9187 
9188  /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9189  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9190 
9191  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9192  the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9193  const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9194 
9195  const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9196  const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9197  const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9198  const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9199  su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9200 
9201  const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], halfArea = 0.5*norm[2];
9202 
9203  /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9204  const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny;
9205 
9206  /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9207  su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9208  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9209  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9210  const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[3] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2]));
9211  const su2double a2L = Gamma*pL*tmp;
9212 
9213  tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9214  const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9215  const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9216  const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[3] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2]));
9217  const su2double a2R = Gamma*pR*tmp;
9218 
9219  /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9220  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9221  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9222  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9223  const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
9224 
9225  /*--- Compute the spectral radii of the left and right state
9226  and take the maximum for the dissipation terms. ---*/
9227  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
9228  const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny;
9229  const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9230  const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9231 
9232  const su2double radL = fabs(unL) + sqrt(fabs(a2L));
9233  const su2double radR = fabs(unR) + sqrt(fabs(a2R));
9234  const su2double rad = max(radL, radR);
9235 
9236  /*--- Compute the flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - rad(UR-UL)). ---*/
9237  const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9238 
9239  flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - rad*dr);
9240  flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx - rad*dru);
9241  flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny - rad*drv);
9242  flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR - rad*drE);
9243  }
9244  }
9245 
9246  break;
9247  }
9248 
9249  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9250 
9251  case 3: {
9252 
9253  /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9254  simultaneously. */
9255  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9256 
9257  /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9258  const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9259  const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9260  const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9261 
9262  /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9263  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9264 
9265  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9266  the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9267  const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9268 
9269  const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9270  const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9271  const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9272  const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9273  su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9274 
9275  const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], nz = norm[2];
9276  const su2double halfArea = 0.5*norm[3];
9277 
9278  /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9279  const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny + gridVel[2]*nz;
9280 
9281  /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9282  su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9283  const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9284  const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9285  const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
9286  const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[4] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2] + vzL*UL[3]));
9287  const su2double a2L = Gamma*pL*tmp;
9288 
9289  tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9290  const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9291  const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9292  const su2double vzR = tmp*UR[3];
9293  const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[4] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2] + vzR*UR[3]));
9294  const su2double a2R = Gamma*pR*tmp;
9295 
9296  /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9297  const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9298  const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9299  const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9300  const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
9301  const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
9302 
9303  /*--- Compute the spectral radii of the left and right state
9304  and take the maximum for the dissipation terms. ---*/
9305  const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
9306  const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny + vzR*nz;
9307  const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9308  const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9309 
9310  const su2double radL = fabs(unL) + sqrt(fabs(a2L));
9311  const su2double radR = fabs(unR) + sqrt(fabs(a2R));
9312  const su2double rad = max(radL, radR);
9313 
9314  /*--- Compute the flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - rad(UR-UL)). ---*/
9315  const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9316 
9317  flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - rad*dr);
9318  flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx - rad*dru);
9319  flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny - rad*drv);
9320  flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pa*nz - rad*drw);
9321  flux[4] = halfArea*(UL[4]*unL + UR[4]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR - rad*drE);
9322  }
9323  }
9324 
9325  break;
9326  }
9327  }
9328 
9329  break;
9330  }
9331 
9332  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9333 
9334  default: {
9335 
9336  /* Riemann solver not explicitly implemented. Fall back to the
9337  implementation via numerics. This is not efficient. */
9338 
9339  /*--- Data for loading into the CNumerics Riemann solvers.
9340  This is temporary and not efficient.. just replicating exactly
9341  the arrays we typically have in order to avoid bugs. We can
9342  probably be more clever with pointers, etc. ---*/
9343  su2double Normal[3];
9344  su2double Prim_L[8];
9345  su2double Prim_R[8];
9346 
9347  Jacobian_i = new su2double*[nVar];
9348  Jacobian_j = new su2double*[nVar];
9349  for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; ++iVar) {
9350  Jacobian_i[iVar] = new su2double[nVar];
9351  Jacobian_j[iVar] = new su2double[nVar];
9352  }
9353 
9354  /* Loop over the number of faces treated simultaneously. */
9355  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9356 
9357  /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9358  const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9359  const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9360  const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9361 
9362  /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9363  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9364 
9365  /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9366  the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9367  const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9368 
9369  const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9370  const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9371  const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9372  const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9373  su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9374 
9375  /*--- Store and load the normal into numerics. ---*/
9376  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim)
9377  Normal[iDim] = norm[iDim]*norm[nDim];
9378  numerics->SetNormal(Normal);
9379 
9380  /*--- Load the grid velocities into numerics. ---*/
9381  su2double vGrid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
9382  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
9383  vGrid[iDim] = gridVel[iDim];
9384  numerics->SetGridVel(vGrid, vGrid);
9385 
9386  /*--- Prepare the primitive states for the numerics class. Note
9387  that for the FV solver, we have the following primitive
9388  variable ordering: Compressible flow, primitive variables nDim+5,
9389  (T, vx, vy, vz, P, rho, h, c, lamMu, eddyMu, ThCond, Cp) ---*/
9390 
9391  /*--- Left primitive state ---*/
9392  Prim_L[0] = 0.0; // Temperature (unused)
9393  Prim_L[nDim+1] = gm1*UL[nVar-1];
9394  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
9395  Prim_L[iDim+1] = UL[iDim+1]/UL[0]; // Velocities
9396  Prim_L[nDim+1] -= gm1*0.5*Prim_L[iDim+1]*UL[iDim+1]; // Pressure
9397  }
9398  Prim_L[nDim+2] = UL[0]; // Density
9399  Prim_L[nDim+3] = (UL[nVar-1] + Prim_L[nDim+1]) / UL[0]; // Enthalpy
9400 
9401  /*--- Right primitive state ---*/
9402  Prim_R[0] = 0.0; // Temperature (unused)
9403  Prim_R[nDim+1] = gm1*UR[nVar-1];
9404  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
9405  Prim_R[iDim+1] = UR[iDim+1]/UR[0]; // Velocities
9406  Prim_R[nDim+1] -= gm1*0.5*Prim_R[iDim+1]*UR[iDim+1]; // Pressure
9407  }
9408  Prim_R[nDim+2] = UR[0]; // Density
9409  Prim_R[nDim+3] = (UR[nVar-1] + Prim_R[nDim+1]) / UR[0]; // Enthalpy
9410 
9411  /*--- Load the primitive states into the numerics class. ---*/
9412  numerics->SetPrimitive(Prim_L, Prim_R);
9413 
9414  /*--- Now simply call the ComputeResidual() function to calculate
9415  the flux using the chosen approximate Riemann solver. Note that
9416  the Jacobian arrays here are just dummies for now (no implicit). ---*/
9417  numerics->ComputeResidual(flux, Jacobian_i, Jacobian_j, config);
9418  }
9419  }
9420 
9421  for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
9422  delete [] Jacobian_i[iVar];
9423  delete [] Jacobian_j[iVar];
9424  }
9425  delete [] Jacobian_i;
9426  delete [] Jacobian_j;
9427 
9428  Jacobian_i = nullptr;
9429  Jacobian_j = nullptr;
9430  }
9431  }
9432 }
9433 
9434 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::LoadRestart(CGeometry **geometry, CSolver ***solver, CConfig *config, int val_iter, bool val_update_geo) {
9435 
9436  /*--- Restart the solution from file information ---*/
9437  unsigned short iVar;
9438  unsigned long index;
9439 
9440  const bool compressible = (config->GetKind_Regime() == ENUM_REGIME::COMPRESSIBLE);
9441 
9442  string restart_filename = config->GetSolution_FileName();
9443 
9444  int counter = 0;
9445  long iPoint_Local = 0; unsigned long iPoint_Global = 0;
9446  unsigned short rbuf_NotMatching = 0;
9447  unsigned long nDOF_Read = 0;
9448 
9449  /*--- Skip coordinates ---*/
9450 
9451  unsigned short skipVars = geometry[MESH_0]->GetnDim();
9452 
9453  restart_filename = config->GetFilename(restart_filename, "", val_iter);
9454 
9455  /*--- Read the restart data from either an ASCII or binary SU2 file. ---*/
9456 
9457  if (config->GetRead_Binary_Restart()) {
9458  Read_SU2_Restart_Binary(geometry[MESH_0], config, restart_filename);
9459  } else {
9460  Read_SU2_Restart_ASCII(geometry[MESH_0], config, restart_filename);
9461  }
9462 
9463  /*--- Load data from the restart into correct containers. ---*/
9464 
9465  counter = 0;
9466  for (iPoint_Global = 0; iPoint_Global < geometry[MESH_0]->GetGlobal_nPointDomain(); iPoint_Global++) {
9467 
9468  /*--- Retrieve local index. If this node from the restart file lives
9469  on the current processor, we will load and instantiate the vars. ---*/
9470 
9471  iPoint_Local = geometry[MESH_0]->GetGlobal_to_Local_Point(iPoint_Global);
9472 
9473  if (iPoint_Local > -1) {
9474 
9475  /*--- We need to store this point's data, so jump to the correct
9476  offset in the buffer of data from the restart file and load it. ---*/
9477 
9478  index = counter*Restart_Vars[1] + skipVars;
9479  for (iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
9480  VecSolDOFs[nVar*iPoint_Local+iVar] = Restart_Data[index+iVar];
9481  }
9482  /*--- Update the local counter nDOF_Read. ---*/
9483  ++nDOF_Read;
9484 
9485  /*--- Increment the overall counter for how many points have been loaded. ---*/
9486  counter++;
9487  }
9488 
9489  }
9490 
9491  /*--- Detect a wrong solution file ---*/
9492  if(nDOF_Read < nDOFsLocOwned) rbuf_NotMatching = 1;
9493 
9494 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
9495  unsigned short sbuf_NotMatching = rbuf_NotMatching;
9496  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&sbuf_NotMatching, &rbuf_NotMatching, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
9497 #endif
9498 
9499  if (rbuf_NotMatching != 0)
9500  SU2_MPI::Error(string("The solution file ") + restart_filename.data() +
9501  string(" doesn't match with the mesh file!\n") +
9502  string("It could be empty lines at the end of the file."),
9503  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
9504 
9505  /*--- Check that the initial solution is physical, report any non-physical nodes ---*/
9506  unsigned long nBadDOFs = 0;
9507 
9508  if( compressible ) {
9509 
9510  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
9511  const unsigned long ii = nVar*i;
9512  su2double DensityInv = 1.0/VecSolDOFs[ii];
9513 
9514  su2double Velocity2 = 0.0;
9515  for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
9516  const su2double vel = VecSolDOFs[ii+iDim]*DensityInv;
9517  Velocity2 += vel*vel;
9518  }
9519 
9520  su2double StaticEnergy = VecSolDOFs[ii+nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
9521 
9522  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(VecSolDOFs[ii], StaticEnergy);
9523  su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
9524  su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
9525 
9526  /*--- Use the values at the infinity if the state is not physical. ---*/
9527  if((Pressure < 0.0) || (VecSolDOFs[ii] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
9528  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVar; ++j) {
9529  VecSolDOFs[ii+j] = ConsVarFreeStream[j];
9530  }
9531 
9532  ++nBadDOFs;
9533  }
9534  }
9535  }
9536 
9537  /*--- Warning message about non-physical points ---*/
9538  if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
9539 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
9540  unsigned long nBadDOFsLoc = nBadDOFs;
9541  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&nBadDOFsLoc, &nBadDOFs, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
9542 #endif
9543 
9544  if((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (nBadDOFs != 0))
9545  cout << "Warning. The initial solution contains "<< nBadDOFs << " DOFs that are not physical." << endl;
9546  }
9547 
9548  /*--- Delete the class memory that is used to load the restart. ---*/
9549 
9550  delete [] Restart_Vars;
9551  delete [] Restart_Data;
9552  Restart_Vars = nullptr; Restart_Data = nullptr;
9553 
9554 }

DENSITY_VELOCITY
